Reviews.Title: “Why not a 5”
Reviews.Author: Doclicter
Reviews.Content: Can't think of any reason not to give this hotel a 5. Stayed 3 nights and loved every minute. Location, staff, amenities, cost. Merci St Sulpice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Erich1234
Reviews.Content: In the heart of old Montreal. Close to shopping, dining, sight seeing and the Metro. Makes for an idle base of operations. Rooms are clean, well appointed and functional. Contain all the amentities you need, included a small kitchen area. The staff was there to assist, and the conceirge efficiently took care of dinner reservations landing us a table at the difficult to visit Au Pied De Cochon. A wonderful stay, hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and superb service in the heart of old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: CharlotandBabette
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights this weekend. The location is superb - right in the heart of old Montreal. The staff are wonderful - they greet you by name once you've registered, the valet parking is quick and efficient, the registration staff lovely. The hotel lobby is tastefully decorated and comfortable. I had stayed here twice before years ago and loved the room. The room this time seemed to be missing something. The furniture was quite scratched and there was a blank wall with extension cords going to lamps - it looks like there should be a chair or table or something to furnish the wall. I don't think we had a queen sized bed but it was very comfy - with a big duvet. The bathroom is terrific - big, modern, clean. Having a little kitchen counter, glasses, bottle opener was great. We had a complementary breakfast in Sinclairs and had invited friends to join us. The continental breakfast buffet is very good - lovely little croissants and pains au chocolat, fruit, cereal. My husband ordered Ã  la carte and said the eggs, sausage, beans, potatoes were not great.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: photographerx
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I stayed here to celebrate our engagement in December 2011. We greatly enjoyed our stay. Excellent location allowed us to leave our car with their valet and walk throughout much of the Old Port as well is only a 5-10 minute walk from the nearest metro station which allows quick access to the rest of the City. We stated in a Deluxe Suite which did not disappoint, a great balcony, wonderful fire place (which we used daily) a large bathroom and a small en suite kitchen which was wonderful for preparing snacks and drinks throughout our stay. The Staff were all lovely and very welcoming and the golden key concierege lived up to their reputation arranging anything and everything we requested. We had drinks in the Sinclair lounge several nights and really enjoyed the bartenders there, they encouraged us to try SortilÃ¨ge - a locally made whiskey infused with maple syrup - this did not disappoint and we left Montreal with several bottles to stock our bar at home. All in all our trip was a complete success thanks to the wonderful staff and beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff makes all the difference!”
Reviews.Author: Asta72
Reviews.Content: Rating: Its not a a fancy over the top luxury hotel a la MO or FS. But it's newly renovated, very clean, comfortable and in a fantastic and surprisingly quiet, location.Â  What really makes this hotel stand out are the people that work there! They truly go above and beyond to make your stay perfect and memorable in every way.Â  Without their amazing staff it would have been a rather un-inspired 4. But taking their amazing staff into account and the rating sky rockets into a shining super 4!! Location: Right in the middle of the old part of Montreal and all it has to offer? Just off the man party street thankfully. Hotel: Newly renovated medium sized boutique hotel in prime location of old Montreal.Â  Staff: I can't thnk of a single employee that didn't do their utmost to make our stay the best it could be! They are warm, friendly, efficient and just lovely people! Room: We were in a suite (123) which was very spacious, bright, quiet, high ceilings, separate shower/bathtub, his and her sinks, quiet and efficient AC, a lot of storage, 2 TVs, crazy good water pressure/heat,Â  The bed could have been larger (queen), but the bed linen were nice and pillows comfortable Easy to make room completely dark! Some rooms apparently have fireplaces too! Both electric and wood depending on room. Nice detail! There are both courtyard rooms and rooms with a street view. So if you crave extra silence go for the courtyard one! AC: Fast, efficient and blissfully quiet! Food: The breakfast has a very small, but perfectly fine, selection. Service is friendly and quick In room dining was ok. A little bit slow, order inaccurate and we were charged to items we had not ordered both times Internet: They charge for it (the premium one!), but not crazily so. Easy to login, and stay logged in + it's rather fast. Regular Internet is free :) Amenities:Â  L'Occitane, kind of basic, but perfectly ok. Small selection Minibar: They provide you with an empty fridge (1 wine bottle doesn't count). Now this is both good and bad as its nice not to have to head outside and stock up the first thing you do. But it's great to have somewhere to store your own stuff on the other hand. There are a lot of little convenient stores around, so it's not a giant trek to find beverages/snacks to buy Plus they can stock it for you upon request Animals: They are an animal friendly hotel! Babysitting: They do offer this and Marie from the company they use was wonderful!! We had her come over 2 nights and I could not have been happier. She is a lovely woman and our daughter took to her straight away!

Reviews.Title: “Further improvements have been made”
Reviews.Author: ebo68
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Saint Sulpice 2/3 times per year when in Montreal for business meetings. After the renovation works of last year, it was clear to me that imporvements have continued at the hotel. Staff was extremely nice, as usual; excellent service; location is right in the heart of old Montreal. I personally didn't like too much the new dÃ©co of the restaurant and especially the acustic... We happened to be there a day while a big group of probably 50-60 people from a conference were having lunch and it was impossible to listen what we were saying. Also somewhat disappointing was the fact that the minibar was empty, with just a bottle of wine in it. I know this could be used for own grocery, but when travelling for business and after a long day I find quite nice to have a drink without needing to call the room service! Beside that, I was again quite satisfied and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel with a fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: This was a one night stop for us on our way from Toronto to Mont Blanc, QC. We decided to break the trip up into 2 parts so we could spend more time on the slopes. When we arrived at the hotel we were immediately impressed by the staff and beauty of the exterior and lobby. This impression continued when we got to the room. It was perfectly sized and a wonder way to spend the evening. We were right in the middle of old Montreal and were able to walk to many different shops and restaurants. We walked to the harbor and enjoyed a nice meal. Not only do I recommend this hotel, I plan on making it part of our trip every year and we will stay an extra day just to enjoy it more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: sunpine
Reviews.Content: We stayed the 9 and 10 0f March arriving grumpy, tired and late after a 5 hour drive from Haliburton Ontario. From check-in to check-out the experience was fantastic. Great room, great staff, great everything. Pulled up to the front door and everything was taken care of for us from there. My last words were 'merci beaucoup et nous serons de retour.'

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expections”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCarolyn
Reviews.Content: I was spending a weekend with a rekindled love. We were looking for something extremely special. When we send our reservation request to the hotel we informed them of how special this weekend was for us. The room we had was spectacular. The location of the hotel is fabulous, not that we went out much.

Reviews.Title: “Old Montreal Hit!”
Reviews.Author: 2012Toronto2012
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel. The regular room was larger than normal. There was a Kitchenaid hotplate, Bodum Kettle, small bar sink, cups, plates etc. The bathroom was very nice as well. The location is right in the middle of Old Montreal behind Notre Dame. Parking is 28 per day valet only. The bed was not very comfortable. It was a "murphy bed". But overall great place and I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Visit to Old Montreal - luxurious, quaint and great location”
Reviews.Author: AllisonKates
Reviews.Content: We had the good fortune to stay two nights this February while visiting family in Montreal. We loved the service provided by the door and desk staff that greeted us each time we came and went. The guest rooms are luxurious and very well appointed with comfortable furniture. Our room could sleep six with a murphy bed, pullout and queen bed in the bedroom. There was a kitchen for preparing light meals so we kept the beer and wine chilled and popped some popcorn one night snuggling in for a movie. I couldn't get over how sound proof the rooms are....I heard not a pipe,voice, or car muffler throughout our entire stay.... we had amazing sleeps. We loved visiting the church next door - and how close great restaurants, shops and people watching locals were. With everything we needed within walking distance, we parked the car upon arrival and left it in the garage until departure three days later. We'll be back in warmer weather to see much more of Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Paul Fulford's review”
Reviews.Author: Paul F
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with the Hotel until we went for breakfast on Sunday Morning. My wife and I had the buffet The buffet was much to expensive for what was offered. The bananas were over ripe and the fruit was hard. We were very disappointed that we ate there. It spoiled our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable weekend in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Murfre
Reviews.Content: We signed up for a Snique Away deal and were rewarded with a very nice vacation and hotel. The suite layout was perfect for our family of four and while we did not attempt to cook we appreciated the kitchenette. Nice big bathtub and roomy shower. Quiet rooms. Great location. Plenty of room to spread out. No complaints. Fold out couch was comfortable and spacious. Thanks Snique Away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, minus the champagne...”
Reviews.Author: McCait
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my mom and sister and we had a great experience (amazing location, great staff, clean rooms, etc.) EXCEPT for when we had a drink one night in the garden. We ordered a cheese plate and two glasses of champagne (didn't specify which) and the bill was $75 for the champagne. We almost choked it back up and told the waiter who returned with the "fixed" bill, which was $50 for the champagne. This really left us with a bad taste in our mouths in an otherwise wonderful 3-night stay with no other issues. We felt rather cheated - if it was indeed that much, at least let us know if the price when ordering.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: TeeJayGirls
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Oct 2009 during our first ever trip to Canada and we enjoyed our stay so much that we decided to stay here again on our 2nd trip to Canada. The location was perfect for us - it is in the beautiful old part of the city where many great restaurants are and very nea the wonderful basilica of Notre Dame. It is also a short walk to a metro station which gives access to the malls on St Catherine and Chinatown for cheap feeds. On this trip we were not so impressed with the room given to us because it was near the lift and the opening and closing of the lift doors were loud enough to keep us up during the night. We discussed this with the reception and requested for another room away from the lifts. Given that it was New Years eve long weekend all rooms were occupied and they couldn't offer us the same type of room which was the superior suite. However they could offer us the Deluxe suite at a discounted price, which we were happy with. At a small additional fee we had a big room with a big bath and more comfortable bed in a more secluded part of the premise. All the staff at the reception, concierge, bell desk and housekeeping were always helpful and friendly. We have never been impressed with the breakfast menu because it is always the same items served and on a few occasions the pastries were stale and the fruits were very old. The floor staff were sometimes unattentive. We never considered dining in their restaurant fearing the lack of service based on our breakfast experiences. Not dining at their restaurant was never an issue for us as there are many exceptional restaurants nearby. Disregarding the disappointment with the breakfast, we feel the hotel room was of standard and good value. I particularly like the small touch of offering a Nespresso machine in every room, as I am a big fan! We would definitely stay at Le Saint Sulpice again if we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great large room with spectacular in room coffee maker”
Reviews.Author: Dominic_3R
Reviews.Content: We were told that the room has just been renovated. It was large with a queen bed, a sofa and arm chair beside, an electric fireplace, a desk, and a kitchenette. The coffee maker makes really good espresso and factor in I have a fansy espresso machine at home! The bathroom has a large bath AND a large shower! You still find a lot of room for two people in there. Beside the restaurent that is average, it is the best place I have been in MontrÃ©al.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Fennix16
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to visit old Montreal for the weekend and I found great reviews about this hotel. It definitely did not dissappoint! The staff were extremely friendly and always willing to help. The hotel was very clean and we ended up getting a free upgrade to a suite. The bed was very comfortable! We are definitely coming back to this hotel when we visit in the summer. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: Miranda F
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a last minute romantic getaway to Old Montreal and came across this charming treasure of a hotel. The cobble stone street entrance made me feel like we were in Europe. The suite we got was inexpensive, massive with a small kitchen and super romantic. Next time in Old Montreal we know where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Great Service”
Reviews.Author: teacherandteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night after we got married. We were upgraded to a suite which was very nice. The hotel does have some quirks, but for a very old building in the heart of Montreal it is very nice. The rooms are clean, bright and comfortable. We had a coffee machine in our room which was nice and the breakfast was excellent. My only complaint is having to hand over your car keys when arriving to the door man. Overall an excellent hotel with lots of character.

Reviews.Title: “Business trip”
Reviews.Author: paulmarket
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful hotel with huge and comfortable rooms (my room was composed by: bath, bedroom, little kitchen, hall with fireplace). The breakfast is served in a nice covered garden. I was here for a business trip and the convention center of the hotel was convenient. The hotel is situated in a strategic position in the old Montreal and near the city centre.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Isa H
Reviews.Content: Great service, beautiful stylish contemporary decor! And even a Tassimo espresso maker in every room. L'Occitane bath products were amazing! Plus free Wi-Fi ! Central as it is located right next to Notre Dame Cathedral! Would definitely recommend this hotel to the most finicky of people!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: WashingtonianGuy
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the hotel. No complaints at all. Great location, great rooms, and great staff. The fireplace is a nice touch. Couple of great restaurants and bars in the hood. You won't be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Small miracle of a boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: LarryLaurence
Reviews.Content: Cozy, comfortable, elegant and reasonably priced the Saint-Sulpice is in the heart of old Montreal between just behind the cathedral. It is quiet, friendly and pet friendly. Although we were in Montreal on the shortest days of the year our first floor room next to a courtyard garden was sunny and welcoming. One of our favorite hotels anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great room!”
Reviews.Author: Avalonbliss
Reviews.Content: Had an executive suite complete with real fireplace and separate large bedroom with king bed. Bed was a bit like a hammock, could be firmer. Nice to have fridge, microwave and cook top - good for restaurant leftovers and keeping the white wine chilled. Bathroom was OK, regular tub/shower combo and not very big. We were there for five days, husband on business and I tagged along as tourist. Great location for walking Old Montreal and along the river. About a thirty minute walk to St. Catherine's for shopping, but doable. Many good restaurants close by and close to Place d'Armes Metro station. Staff are very professional and friendly. Good if you get a special rate or upgrade, but their web rate of over $900.00 a night is more than I would pay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Schnap
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a deluxe suite with separate bedroom betweeen Christmas and New Year's and had a very relaxing and enjoyable holiday. The large suite had a separate living room with flat screen tv, large windows and kitchenette with everything you need if you are inclined to cook on vacation. The bathroom very large and clean with separate bath and shower. The bedroom was smaller but with closets on both sides for enough space to put away lots of stuff. One caveat, which is more personal taste, we would prefer a firmer mattress on the bed. The location is perfect for exploring the old city surrounded by lots of restaurants and a short walk from the Metro to explore the rest of the city. Also a very easy commute to the train station and with the flat rate for taxis to the airport very easy. We would recommend the Saint Sulpice especially for families with children for more space. We got a very good deal thru hotels.com - would we pay full price ? Not so sure...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Choice - Reasonably Priced”
Reviews.Author: crocon
Reviews.Content: Le Saint-Sulpice is a nice hotel choice when you're in Old Montreal. It is reasonably priced, conveniently located (just off Rue St. Paul Ouest), clean, safe and spacious. All rooms are suites. The staff is not as personable as those at Le Petit Hotel just up the street but you can get excellent advice from the concierge. Having made the Le Petit Hotel comparison I should point out that this is a much larger hotel with many more rooms and a greater volume of guests. Included in the price I paid was a free cold breakfast consisting of fresh fruit, toast, breads, coffee, croissants, etc... I liked the croissants and the fruit was fresh and tasty for the most part but the coffee was not to my liking at all, so much so that I just couldn't drink something that tasted like hotel chain Folgers. There is also a large dining room with a restaurant that received excellent reviews from those with whom I spoke. I wasn't staying long so I didn't get a chance to dine here. Thus I cannot comment on the restaurant dining. The hotel lobby is quite spacious and interesting. There's an outdoor patio area that looks very attractive but I was here in winter. I would probably return to sample the fare and to dine in such an appealing setting in warmer weather. This establishment promotes itself as a "boutique hotel" and I'm not quite sure I would agree. Yes, there are some aspects that do resemble some of the finer boutique hotels I've stayed at (The Hudson in NYC, The Delano in Miami Beach, etc...) but this one is not in the same class in my mind. The bathroom would certainly be considered of "boutique" rating but less so the furnishings, carpeting, inadequate and poor lighting and the overall decor which seemed tired and longing for better days. I will say that otherwise the room was spacious, well furnished, comfortable and included a small kitchenette. The bed provided a solid mattress and afforded a sound sleep, something which I value highly. Would I return to this hotel and/or recommend it to others? Yes. It's a good value and the convenience can't be much better if you want to be in the old city.

Reviews.Title: “Old Montreal Jewel - Le Saint-Sulpice”
Reviews.Author: ThereseNyman
Reviews.Content: We love to visit Old Montreal always something happening in this beautiful city. Our favourite hotel is Le Saint-Sulpice Suites, first class from the minute you pull the car up to the door. Valet service on arrival, smiling staff everywhere, fast check-in, bags arrived to our room in a flash and our one bedroom suite was spacious, comfortable and very cozy with a gas fireplace. Very clean and we appreciated the cooking facilities which we used for breakfast. Located close to the convention center we used the â€œunderground cityâ€� to walk uptown and do some shopping ok alot!.. :) Back at the hotel we went down to the bar for a cocktail before we headed out for supper, there are so many good restaurants just take your pick. We saw John Malkowich who was staying at the hotel for a movie production called Warm Bodies.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, warm, quiet, comfortable and roomy”
Reviews.Author: lots-of-km
Reviews.Content: Perfect stay in August 2011. Large suite with kitchenette and dining area, historic limestone walls, modern furniture. In the heart of Old Montreal, close to the Metro, surrounded by pleasant night life, and a very easy commute from the rail station. The reception desk staff were friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: MPLSKevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over the Christmas and Boxing Day holidays. The hotel is in an outstanding location, directly behind Notre Dame and steps away from the shops and restaurants of Rue St. Paul. The room was fairly large, and included a small kitchenette. The bathroom was spacious, and had a separate (large) tub and walk-in shower. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel staff were polite and helpful. There isn't a gym inside the hotel; but they have access to a very small facility about one block away. There is free wifi in the hotel, but it was pretty slow.

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Rowena53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a class Euorpean style operation. The lobby is stunning, small in scale and decorated in warm tones. There is a beautiful bar and adjoing courtyard which must be gorgeous in the summer. We were upgraded to an executive suite that was outfitted with everything and more. The living had a stylish electric fireplace and a Murphy bed which was comfortably made up for our son. The bathroom was spacious, outfitted with a bath and full shower, and L'Occitane products. The kitchen comes with a microwave, Nespresso machine and dishes. The service was friendly and efficient, the only exception being extra towels which we twice requested at the front desk and were never delivered. Location is fantastic, down the street from Notre Dame Basilica and steps from the waterfront. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Don't eat there”
Reviews.Author: lars_nielsen
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately anything that related to food at this hotel was a disappointment to us. We ordered 4 Diet Cokes from room service. All cokes were more than 8 months past their expiration date (yes, 8 months), and the hotel had run out of fries, jam and a number of other day-to-day items, despite being almost empty. During the 4 days we were there, missing items were never restocked. Staff were friendly and happy to apologize for anything missing or wrong, but no one seemed empowered do anything about it or pass on the message. For frequent travellers who are used at staying at hotels, and perhaps on limited time and therefore just needs things to work, I recommend staying somewhere else. On the plus side, the location is great, the rooms are nice and spacious and the in-room products are great. It is just the service that fails.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Steps from Notre Dame Basilica in Vieux Montreal”
Reviews.Author: bluenote18
Reviews.Content: Le Saint-Sulpice is a very nice hotel that just misses greatness. Recently renovated, it shines with a stylish decor of red and black, punched up with bold designs accented by dark wood and stainless steel. We got a wonderful room that was spacious, located in the back away from street and elevator noise, and was blissfully quiet. It also came with a kitchenette, a balcony, and an electric fireplace. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was spacious with a soaking tub and separate shower. The staff is attentive and personable. And its location is top notch - its entrance is half a block away from the Notre Dame Basilica and an easy walk to the old port area. What's missing? Well, its restaurant is a bit of a head snap. It has the same bold red and black colors and a gorgeous ceiling of sculpted wood. It is located below ground and you look up and out to the sidewalk through windows framed by wrought iron trellises. Despite the little flowers carved into the grillwork, the restaurant feels a bit like an underground prison, especially in the daytime when it is light out and it feels cold and dark inside. The layout is reminiscent of a school cafeteria with rectangular tables lined up in a straight line down the middle and interspersed along the wall directly under the sidewalk. A long red banquette runs the length of that wall and looks uncomfortable at best. Maybe it's better at night when it's dark outside so you don't know what you're missing. The kitchenette is a great convenience. It comes equipped with all the basics you need to cook. But, the microwave is tucked into an upper cabinet above the cooktop and high above your head. You risk spilling something hot on your face anytime you take heated food out of the microwave. The breakfast buffet is continental and no better than it needs to be - three kinds of croissants, a basket of sliced bread, two meats (a salami, a ham), three types of sliced melon, a bowl of plain yogurt, two cerreals, juice and coffee. The coffee tastes watery, disappointing in a French hotel/restaurant. Finally, and this is probably a quirk of mine, I am not partial to fragranced lobbies and rooms. Le Saint-Suplice fragrances the lobby to create an aura of spa and serenity. OK if you don't mind that scent, but it didn't appeal to me and I found myself holding my breath each time I passed through.

Reviews.Title: “20th Anniversary Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Ginny M
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our 20th wedding anniversary and wanted something romantic and cozy.Le Saint-Sulpice fit the description. The room was perfect and the staff was wonderful. I cannot wait to return to Montreal and this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing rooms, service, and dog friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Cory S
Reviews.Content: One of the best experiences I've had with a hotel. The location is great, every staff person I encountered was friendly, and incredibly helpful. The room was bigger than we imagined, clean, and pretty luxurious (large deep tub, gas fireplace, Nespresso maker, two TVs, great bed, etc...) And on top of all this, they welcome dogs. No "dog smell" in the room, no attitude from staff or other customers, very accommodating in terms of cleaning the room when we were out with our dog. This will be where I always stay. Oh, and there's free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SusanOT_11
Reviews.Content: Really cute hotel, friendly front desk staff, great location in the heart of Vieux Montreal--but we were disappointed by one huge issue. Our first night, we were shown to a lovely large room with a fireplace. In bed that night, we were unhappily surprised by multiple insects in our bed! (Not bedbugs, but not really sure what they were!) Our call to the front desk brought someone immediately who agreed there was a problem & moved us to another room down the hall. After finally falling asleep that night, the rest of our stay was pleasant & uneventful. We were, however, disappointed that management didn't offer to compensate us in some way--a glass of wine at the bar perhaps, or breakfast? On the whole though, we had a good experience there & would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great fun”
Reviews.Author: cscott02
Reviews.Content: We had a lot of fun staying here in Montreal. We got a deal on SniqueAway, and the price for the size of the room was amazing. We were also in a great location, right in Old Montreal and just a few metro stops away from the Plateau where everything is hopping. There was great shopping nearby as well. We also got good service, and everyone spoke English, which was helpful for us. Wifi was free, which was great compared to hotels in US. The only bad things were that the breakfast was not included in the morning (boo) and reception/valet messed up our cars, overcharging us for a car that wasn't ours (luckily we caught it) and making us wait for almost 45 minutes when we were ready to leave. The beds are also really small (might be a non-American thing, not sure). Other than that, it was wonderful

Reviews.Title: “a true gem”
Reviews.Author: cazb85
Reviews.Content: Can't say anything negative, arrived at midnight, the girl at the front desk was happy and ready to check me in. I received an upgrade, the room was huge! the bed was so comfortable I nearly did not want to leave to go sightseeing! Great Location, walking distance to many shops, restaurants and smack bang in the middle of the old town. They price is actually well worth it, and you can't say that about many places these days! If I am ever back in Montreal I now know where to go!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: MerMer21
Reviews.Content: I rely heavily on reviews for visiting all over the world. This hotel was hands down one of the nicest and most beautiful places. It was a extremely spacious room, with a queen bed, couch, fire place, large fridge, stove and sink and a window that opened toward the street and a good size bathroom. Everyone that worked there was very helpful and nice and we felt very welcomed. The location is perfect and very central to a grocery store, liquor store, restaurants, etc. I would highly recommend this Hotel and really enjoyed our stay because of it.

Reviews.Title: “â€œFor 6 years, our favourite stay in Montreal. Never disappointedâ€�”
Reviews.Author: Grimsbybud
Reviews.Content: Our last visit to Hotel Le Saint-Sulpice, in Old Montreal, was over three days (October 20-23, 2011) and, as with all our past stays since 2005, our anticipation was rewarded. This is our favourite (and only for the past years) place to stay in Montreal, with good reason! We arrived at Saint-Sulpice during one of the most violent lightning and rain storms we've seen. As our Taxi arrived at the door, we were met by two, brave, gentlemen who whisked us into the lobby and retrieved our luggage...with big smiles and "Welcome"s. Our suite was perfect. Everything was in order, as we expect. The only thing we needed to request was additional coffee packs as we do enjoy a few in the morning to get going. It was done, immediately. This is no surprise as we have, always, found each member of the staff to be service minded. As another example of this care, I am Lactose intolerant and the mere mention of this to Josie-Anne at the breakfast buffet was met with an offer to prepare a special breakfast for me. Not a moment's hesitation! Given the weather that day, we asked the Concierge on duty (Etienne Bellemare) for a recommendation. I had a craving for Lamb and my wife, as ever, wanted seafood. Etienne directed us to Modavie, a place we had passed many time but did not look in. It was a perfect recommendation. In the past he had done the same for us several times. Continuity of staff has proven to be a bonus. Maxim at reception, there for us for years, is another proof of the hotel's desire to keep the best. With thanks to General Manager, M. Di Re, we arrived to find our anniversary being marked by a very nice bottle of wine! Despite the rain, a perfect start to our renewing our love of Old Montreal. We have travelled, and stayed, in a great number of hotels, inns and Bed and Breakfasts across North America, Australia and New Zealand, and most of Europe. All in all, we have had some very pleasant experiences, everywhere. Yet, a return to "our hotel" in Le Saint Sulpice is one we are always keen to enjoy: Pleasant, warm, friendly and like a second home. As retired folks who seek all of these things whenever possible, knowing that they will, always, be there for us at Saint Sulpice is a reward in itself. Do entertain Le Saint-Sulpice if planning to visit the Old City ( and China Town just a short walk away!).

Reviews.Title: “Favourite Montreal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keena_b
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at the Saint-Sulpice at least 6 or 7 times, since 2003. We love the location. Right around the corner from the Notre Dame Cathedral, in Old Montreal, close to the subway, a short walk to the old port and to many fantastic restaurants. We always book a one bedroom apartment. It's perfect for a family. The breakfast buffet is good. The hotel is clean and modern. The staff is attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TwoOfUs89
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saint-Sulpice hotel two weeks ago and it was just amazing! Our room was really spacious, the furniture is stylish and the staff is very professional. The hotel is located in the old montreal and is next to almost all interesting spots. I definitely recommend this hotel and will come back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Deceptive Website”
Reviews.Author: EileenY24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 4 nights the the Saint-Sulpice in Montreal. During our stay, we were in and out of the hotel many times a day. However, we were not greeted even once upon entry or exit, despite the front deck being fully staffed and the concierge standing near the door. Three of four days, we returned in the evening to have the concierge and bellman standing outside in front of the entry, but they did not move or open the door for us until I loudly said "Pardon!" en francais. The maid service in our room was extremely inconsistent - no turn down service on Sunday night, trash emptied one day, bottled water left outside the door another day. Our "suite" was large, but not as shown on the website, and the carpet was stained in several places, the coffee table and vanity in the bathroom were scratched and chipped, and tiles in the bathroom also chipped. Grout in the shower was not all clean, but black in corners. Pros?? Continental breakfast was nice - good coffee when you could get it, and good pain au chocolat. Service without a smile for 4 days though. We would not return as surely there must be better service at these prices elsewhere in Vieux Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Romantic Weekend Spot!”
Reviews.Author: JeG0
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a weekend get a way and the Saint-Sulpice was a perfect destination. We stayed for two nights and took advantage of their package which included two passes to the Scandinavian Spa. The spa was only a block away and heavenly. Although we had a rainy weekend, our deluxe suite was very comfortable and inviting with a fireplace and balcony over looking Old Montreal. All of the staff we encountered were very helpful but I cannot say enough about the Concierge. His recommendations were exactly what we were looking for in terms of restaurants, walking routes and entertainment. We were also very impressed with the selection and scope of the continental breakfast. Don't forget to try the croissants! We would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Montreal. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel in Montreal, stylish, beautiful location, lovely staff !!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine F
Reviews.Content: I would like to share my appreciation of the hotel the St-Sulpice. I go there several times a year for leisure or work, and each time the experience is fantastic. The staff ; employees of the reception, reservations, doorman, waiters are all extremely friendly, courteous and especially, very attentive. They do everything they can to satisfy the customer and this is greatly appreciated and makes all the difference. Quality, luxury and comfort of the rooms distinguish your hotel. Almost all rooms are different from each other and have a little something unique to make each stay an new experience, but always impeccable. I love the quality products from L'Occitane given in the room. The cleanliness is exemplary and the services of the hotel too! The hotel is very chic, modern, relaxing, tastefully decorated, quiet, intimate and the location is perfect, close to restaurants, shopping, bars, great location in Old Montreal. I have celebrated my last birthday with friends, I had a beautiful and large executive suite with a huge terrace, to share a good meal and have a drink with a beautiful view of Montreal. The rooms are so spacious that no matter the occasion, whether with my family, my friends, my boyfriend or alone, the experience is always perfect! I look forward to my next visit in November! This is my favorite hotel in Montreal and I recommend it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Anthony A
Reviews.Content: Everything was fantastic during each of my stays or visits to this hotel ! I went there a dozen of times last year for business cocktails as well as for a birthday party in a suite of the hotel. I can sincerely say that I was impressed by their team, the location, the bar and the rooms ! Nothing to complain about, we were always in for quite an experience ! This boutique hotel is one of the finest in Montreal. In the heart of the Old Montreal, a few minutes away from the business center as well as the Port of Montreal, business men and families alike will find a great value. I definitely recommend it !!

Reviews.Title: “Still great, years later”
Reviews.Author: Ttaylo3
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Saint-Sulpice on a number of occassions for a number of reasons over the past eight years, and it's still as nice now as it first was. The service at check in was exceptional and continued throughout our stay. We had a suite on the first floor (102) and the room was well appointed and clean. The bed, in the master bedroom was comfortable, but be forewarned... it's not a Queen. Thankfully, I was the only one sleeping in it. Had drinks at the hotel both nights of our stay... staff was very attentive and helpful. My only concern was that at 8:30 on Saturday morning, we clearly heard drilling and hammering... and frankly, expected to see it happening outside of our room. This continued until almost 10:00 a.m. Not really something that you would expect from a hotel that focuses so much on the guest's experience . All told though, an excellent hotel... great location and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “My birthday stay was amazing at Le Saint Sulpice”
Reviews.Author: susan u
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect during my recent stay at Le Saint Sulpice. The service from each of the staff was friendly and efficient. The rooms are extremely large and very comfortable and I appreciate the gererous sizes of L'Occitane bath products and the Nespresso coffee and coffee maker..yum. I was lucky enough to have a huge private terrace just off the living room. It was ideal for sipping champagne with dear friends and family as the sun set. Dinner at les 400 coups (very close by on rue Notre Dame) was outstanding. A perfectly mixed cocktail at the hotel bar was the bittersweet end to an amazing day in Montreal. I literally fell into the super-comfortable king bed and slept like a baby. The waterfront at the old port is just steps away and so an early morning jog was in order to clear my head. I will definitley stay at Le Saint Sulpice whenever I am in Montreal. I love it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: 1morefoodie
Reviews.Content: I can't believe this lovely boutique hotel in Montreal is not in the top 10 list of recommended accommodations. We had a beautifully appointed suite with living room (including a sofa bed for our daughter), separate bedroom and full kitchenette for the price or a regular hotel room anywhere else. The setup is perfect for families, but the quaint, nicely furnished and quiet room would also make this a great choice for a romantic getaway. And the location couldn't be better -- right in the heart of Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: CKap
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a perfect location. The rooms are suites, with a living room, bedroom and separate bathroom. The staff was very welcoming and very professional.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: ager01
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the heart of Old Montreal, very attentive service from the car parking valet to the reception manager. The toiletries and the bedding are excellent, the room interior is in need of some updating though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful boutique hotel in the middle of Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: soyrubiamad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Saint-Sulpice for our honeymoon trip to Montreal and it couldn't have been a better experience. The room was beautiful and quiet, amazingly comfortable bed, friendly staff and a great bar/restaurant downstairs. The location was perfect, we spent a lot of time walking around Old Montreal, which is beautiful, and it was an easy walk to the convention center/theatre area where the Jazz Festival was going on. Also only a few blocks from the water.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, reliable spot in Old Town Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Hentyfan
Reviews.Content: With nearby street construction, closures, detours, etc., getting to the hotel entrance by car this summer was a challenge. But once at the hotel, things were good. I don't think we were on one of the renovated floors, but our suite was quiet, spacious, and comfortable, even if the decor and furnishings were a bit tired. Nice continental breakfast, buffet-style, on the patio. Friendly, efficient check-in, check-out, and valet service. Our daughter was disappointed that there was no gym on the premises, despite what the in-room literature said. With three prior stays in the past five years or so, this is likely to become our reliable spot in the Vielle Ville.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Location for Tourists”
Reviews.Author: kaphie
Reviews.Content: Never having visited Montreal before and wanting to see the historical part of the city we looked for a place in old Montreal. By checking Trip Advisor and AAA recomendations we found Le Saint-Sulpice. Not very far from the river and close to Notre Dame Basilica and many other old, old buildings. It was lovely and even accomodated our dogs. We had an upgrade coupon so we were given a beautiful Queen Suite at a very reasonable price. It was so big it looked like a mini-condo and windows where we could walk right out into the main patio. A free breakfast was fresh and delicious. Parking was not good as the hotel was doing some remodeling in the back but the valet was so helpful and found us a convenient and safe place for our auto and trailer.Will definitely stay there when we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very good for business and tourism”
Reviews.Author: Tex68
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Sain Sulpice a few times, and I was curious to see the results of the renovation works of last May. The style has remained the same, no major changes, a nice refurbishment of the rooms and a new lounge/bar area on the ground floor. Pity that there is no longer the gym. Although small, it was very handy to have it on the 6th floor, instead of having to go to a gym outside the hotel. The restaurant is now limited to the terrasse, which was very nice in August, but I wonder how it will be in winter... A negative remark for the room service list: very short and offering the same choice of the daily lunch. Luckily enough the hotel is well located with plenty of nice restaurants and brasseries nearby. Service remains very good.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nick_from_toronto
Reviews.Content: Having staying in other hotels in the old montreal area and never in this one, I thought I would stay here for 2 nights this past weekend. I was very impressed with the loft room as it was very spacious and had nice decor. To my amazement there was a fully functional kitchenette in the room which really helped. The best part was the espresso coffee machine ! Checkin and check out was very smooth and the good thing was the room was very quiet at night since being old montreal it tends to get loud after hours but I did not hear anything. The bathroom was very spacious and clean with high end fitttings. Overall very good stay and look forward to going back in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “restful luxury”
Reviews.Author: kelleyviolets
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip alone since the birth of our daughter 3 years ago so we wanted it to be restful, luxurious and elegant. It was all three, definitely. Our room --- a Deluxe Suite -- was on the 6th floor and had both a fireplace and a balcony. The room, while slightly in decor, felt like our own personal pied-a-terre in old Mtl - we loved coming back for a late afternoon nap, cocktail hour on the patio and time to get ready for dinner in the well-appointed bathroom. The espresso machine was a great touch and continental breakfast on the Terrace was all we could have asked for to set off each great day. The neighbourhood is under construction, but there are still lots of opportunities for lovely moonlit walks down cobblestone streets. The hotel recommends some great restaurants on its website (see: "for foodies") and we tried two of them (thanks to reservations by the Concierge) and were totally amazed at the quality of the food. All in all, the Saint Sulpice feels very old school, quiet, and lovely - not for the party crowd or those who want the most modern feel - but wonderful for those who want to just enjoy a true Montreal vibe in a great area.

Reviews.Title: “St. Sulpice is fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: triploverAZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at St. Suplice. We had a beautiful suite. It had a small kitchen, a large living room and a seperate bedroom. The room was immaculate. The hotel staff is terrific - couldn't have been more helpful. The location is perfect in old Montreal, near the water and on the back side of Notre Dame Church. It is also close to the subway. We LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - terrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: globalgirlLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Saint-Sulpice for 6 nights with our 19 month old daughter. Having a toddler it was important to stay in a hotel with a separate bedroom as well as kitchen facilities. I would definately reccommend Le Saint-Sulpice for this! Great spacious, clean rooms with fabulous facilities. We got one with a terrace and had dinner outside most nights. The location of the hotel is also fantastic. Right in the old town of Montreal with cobbled streets, restaurants and a childrens playground at the old Port. There is also a fantastic childrens day nursery with spa facilities for parents about a 20 minute walk down Rue Notre Dame called Parentheses Montreal. A MUST for anyone with kids! The only dissappointment was the hotel restaurant where we had breakfast each morning. Since we stayed for 6 nights it shouldn't have been a surprise that we wanted a high-chair each morning but unfortunately we had to ask every day and they would have to go and fetch a usually soaking wet chair (left out in the rain all night!) which they would then dry and give to us for the baby. We would have to beg for coffee and butter for our toast - usually got it after about 3 requests. Also, the breakfast was the same for all 6 days! Not even a change of yoghurt choice or fruit.Not what I'd expect from a 4 star hotel. We also ordered room service (which comes from the hotel restaurant). We ordered chicken for our daughter which was undercooked when it arrived. Since she was so hungry we didnt send it back but microwaved it to ensure it was fully cooked. It was also overcharged on the room service bill. When we complainted to the restaurant manager he refused to belive it had been undercooked and said that the chicken they use sometimes looks rose coloured when cooked and then went into detailed explanations about their cooking techniques! For $22 I'd expect fully cooked chicken! In summary - fantastic hotel but avoid the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Here”
Reviews.Author: WhiteMountainsFamily
Reviews.Content: (We actually stayed here in August of 2010, not September). The rooms here are elegant and comfortable. The staff is helpful and respectful, especially with the valet parking. The restaurant has excellent food and service. Breakfast is good. We loved it here.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible breakfast is a dealbreaker.”
Reviews.Author: ideefixe310
Reviews.Content: The St Sulpice may have been a pleasant hotel, maybe even recently. It now seems committed to a dizzying spiral into seediness. The worst first: the breakfast service is breathtakingly bad. You cannot get coffee. We had to get up and beg the hostess to send somebody to serve us a small, weak first cup. A second cup is a mad dream. The buffet has good baked goods, cheese, good ham, cereal and yogurt, and bowls of fruit which deteriorated from nice fruit salad at first to watermelon our last day. Perversely inconvenient use of the attractive garden/lobby space, with the waiting-to-be-seated line mingling awkwardly with the buffet line, the routes from tables to buffet blocked off for no apparent reason with big planters so you have to weave between close tables and laden (but coffeeless) servers to get to the buffet. One day we were made to wait seven minutes for a table to be set although there were many empty tables and few diners. Another day we were refused service when we arrived ten minutes before the end of breakfast hours. The coffee issue would be less desperate if you could get coffee in your room. There is a very fancy coffee pod machine in your room. The machines and pods are for sale. You get 3 thimble-sized pods and a piece of paper saying the first 3 are free, all others (more in fridge) $2.50 each. Per day or per stay? There was no documentation stating terms the second day, so we didnâ€™t dare use any more (it would have taken at least 9 to caffeinate all 3 of us adequately). We chose the St-S because it has suites â€“ but coffee (espresso sized) cups, toiletries, towels etc are all for 2 (of the 3 free thimbles, one was decaf so doesnâ€™t count); first day no bathrobes, second day, 2 not 3 bathrobes showed up. Of course we could have called Housekeeping but (1) this should not be necessary and (2) occasional lapses into insolence at front desk did not make us eager to talk to hotel personnel. There are bottles of water in the room and more (2) brought (waking us from desperately needed, hard-won nap) ostentatiously delivered in the afternoon but nothing to say what they might cost. So much has changed so recently at the St-S. that the Guest Manual has an Errata sheet, but some disparities are still not covered in the errata. Fridge is said to be stocked and a price list on counter but there was just one bottle of wine and coffee thimbles, nothing else, in fridge, and no price list. There were a bottle of champagne, 2 glasses, and a card about $49 on the counter. So general atmosphere of commercialism and dangerous money-grabbing booby traps throughout room, causing anxiety, defensiveness, and hostility to the hotel. Warm water in ice bucket when we arrived, so overall cleanliness suspect. Since spa has disappeared, hotel now offers guests use of gym nearby. This gym is small, crowded, and unpleasant. It was not clear whether guests could or could not use a second, reportedly nice gym farther awayâ€”hotel itself can't seem to keep up with the massive negative changes, different staff say different things. Room has nice upholstered furniture but wood pieces are nicked, battered and unpolished, seedy looking (they won't spring for a bottle of Old English??). My mattress might have been OK for some; I needed firmer. Bedroom window handle missing, toilet paper holder loose. The hotel is quick to tell you the bedroom is fully private and bath has separate entrances, but they have installed lightly frosted GLASS PANELS around the sink facing the bedroom. So if you turn on lights in the night it disturbs folks in bedroom, and folks in bedroom have to make effort not to notice sink activities. (The whole worldwide transparent-bathrooms-in-hotels thing: let's have a show of hands, how many like transparent bathrooms??) A gigantic fake fireplace protrudes annoyingly into the room (esp. awkward in relation to Murphy bed, which we could have called them to raise and lower every day but didnâ€™t). There is said to be a device to operate the fireplace somewhere but we couldnâ€™t find it. It was summer, we didnâ€™t care, but just one more stupid oversight on the part of the hotel. AC satisfactory but very loud. One tea light for the signature red candle, no refills. Wonder how much we would be charged for a second tea light. Attitude: The St. S. is very hard to get to by car at present because of constructions blocks in combination with one-way streets. This is not hotel's fault, but when we arrived and said we had had a hard time, the front desk informed us that no, it's very easy. The next day a veteran Montreal cab driver arrived 20 minutes late driving the wrong way up the street and almost in tears with frustration because he couldnâ€™t find a way there. Worse: the Guest Manual says there's a nice bar in the lobby where you can meet a friend, have a drink before setting out, etc etc â€“ the things people do in hotel bars. So, 2 of our party (20-somethings, admittedly overpolite and underdressed, but quite presentable) went down for a drink. They were told no, you can't just have a drink, this is a full-service restaurant (Bagatelle. Donâ€™t go there.). Eventually they were allowed to sit at a side table. They asked for the wine list. The waitress said No. They asked her to suggest some wines. She brought them a glass of chilled red wine that tasted strongly of vinegar, presumably how it was supposed to taste but exotic and obviously not what young people barely past the white Zinfandel stage wanted, and a glass of nice white. I joined them and we had a total of 5 glasses. The bill was $76, the excess owing to the bizarre red. Maybe not that far out of line for a hotel bar, but clearly involving active hostility from the waitress. The young people insisted on tipping her anyway. Positives: Great location. Very quiet. Front desk efficient, quick to make restaurant reservation, call taxi, though they may sneer at you. Not good enough. Skip the St Sulpice.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Beached56
Reviews.Content: Great location. Good room size. Very comfortable. We stayed 2 nights on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in vieux montreal”
Reviews.Author: James48486
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended by a friend and it was an absolute treasure. Located in the heart of old Montreal, it is within walking distance of the metro, great restaurants and the waterfront. It is often challenging to find a room that accomodates 2 adults and six children, and after having no luck online, I called the hotel directly and was told they do have one room that could not only accomodate us but there was a kitchenette, free internet access (similar hotels charge $15 per night) and free breakfast for two each morning on their beautiful terrace dining room. Normally I would have paid twice as much for the same accomodations. The rooms were beautifully kept, well appointed and with turn down service each night. The concierge made excellent dinner suggestions and the staff were helpful and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, dated room”
Reviews.Author: Kuzo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at Le Saint-Sulpice. We had a wonderful time exploring the city for the first time, and loved the location of this hotel in Old Montreal. I choose this hotel because it offered suite style rooms for our family of four. The hotel's website showed beautifully renovated rooms, but unfortunately, we were placed in an older room which showed some wear and tear (torn carpet, banged up furniture and worn out couch cushions). The layout of our room was also different from what is shown on the website, and it felt cramped. Service was also inconsistent..the front desk staff, concierge and valets were very professional, but the restaurant staff at breakfast were so unfriendly that I chose not to eat there after our first visit (and breakfast was included in my stay). I would highly recommend staying in Old Montreal, but not sure this is the best place to do it.

Reviews.Title: “Service is sub par”
Reviews.Author: burnhamdesign
Reviews.Content: We were on a trip to New England, looking at colleges with our daughter, and at the last minute decided to drive up to Montreal for a couple of nights. My husband's assistant found us the hotel Ste. Sulpice, and told us they'd offered us the Presidential Suite for a huge discount, which sounded great. The hotel has a terrific location in the center of the old city, and seems proud of its boutique hotel status, but the level of service just isn't on the level of other boutique hotels at all. The rooms are clean and large, decor seemed new although fairly unsophisticated. Suite had everything we needed, including a large rooftop terrace, so accomisations were comfortable. After arriving, I called downstairs to ask if I could get some things pressed, and the front desk told me housekeeping was closed but why didn't I find the ironing board and do it myself? Then we got ready to go to the gym (advertised in hotel brochure as 24 hour), and were told it was closed (it was 7 pm on a Friday). Later that evening, I called the front desk and asked if they had nail polish remover and I got silence, followed by "we don't have anything like THAT". Hmmmm, ok, so I just stayed at the Mercer in NYC where they'll run out to the grocery for you at 2am if you need anything, and I know that's exceptional service, but really? Is nail polish remover that bizarre a request from a traveler in a "4 star" (what does that rating mean, anyway?) hotel? Day 2, we returned from our day at 5pm to find housekeeping making up our room (5pm), and then my husband headed down to the gym and guess what? It was closed-"closed on weekends" they told him. Aren't weekends when most people GO to the gym?! There were other little things, like the guy who took my breakfast order and had to keep asking someone in the background if they had what I was ordering, as well as really slow Internet service. All in all, I think the hotel needs to visit some of it's competition to see what good service involves. It's kind if like this is a basic middle of the road, touristy hotel masquerading as an upscale, luxury one. Perfectly clean and comfortable, but really not up to snuff.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ibbm
Reviews.Content: As a free quant traveller I would say this hotel is high up my list of great stays. This is a great hotel for business or vacation stay. The rooms are big and clean and the hotel is very well located, everything is within a short ride or walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneSkNewJersey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for two nights the end of July 2011 and were very pleased. It is very clean and new with plush bedding. I found a rate of $175.00 online and was upgraded when we arrived to a suite with separate bedroom. Breakfast wasn't included, but there were several places within a few blocks to choose from. We ate dinner at the hotel on the patio and it was excellent, but they charged $13.00 for a glass of wine which we thought was excessive. The dinner prices were comparable to others in the area. This location in old town can't be beat. Staff was very friendly and professional. Refrigerator and microwave in the room plus dishes and glasses. We got 2 bottles of water each day and the weather report. The hotel was very quiet. Our room faced the street, but we didn't hear any street noise. We took a bus tour that ended in the water and probably wouldn't do that again. It was just ok, not a must. If you walk out to the end of the waterfront piers by the clocktower and look back at the Old town at night, it is beautifully illuminated. There were fireworks one night which is why we walked out so fat and we were very glad we did. Overall a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated...very disappointed and definitely not worth the money...would never go back”
Reviews.Author: travelguru7777777
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently visited the hotel and we were very disappointed at the quality of service of the hotel. This is our fifth visit to Old Montreal, we absolutely love the city and the sites. Upon our arrival to the hotel we approached the concierge to check in and was brushed off by one of the staff "alain" who told us to wait for his colleague to help us. He clearly was not busy but for some reason didn't have to time for us. The staff are not friendly, we have been to other hotels in Old Montreal and they are always smiling, saying hello and always willing to help and suggest places for us to go. When returning back to our rooms, none of the staff including the concierge would acknowledge us or even smile or say hello. The room was decent but not what you would expect for the price you pay. The sofa bed was absolutely terrible, the mattress was old and uncomfortable. The breakfast selection is poor to say the least. There are no eggs (extra charge), 5 slices of cold meats, small variety of fruit, cheese and toast. I've been to other hotels with a much better selection of french pastries, fruit, eggs, cheeses, etc. Upon checking out we were never asked about how we enjoyed our stay and were charged for items at breakfast without the staff telling us about it Overall we would never go back! What a shame especially for the ridiculous amount they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: 25cw
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my sister's lunch wedding reception. Our room was ready when we arrived at 10am which was a lovely surprise. The room was a beautiful suite that my kids loved. The sitting area was large and very comfortable. There was also a small kitchen area with microwave, sink, fridge and I believe even a cooktop. It had pots and pans, dishes, everything you needed to eat. Only thing it didn't really have was a table to eat at that was large enough for 4 people. We have 3 kids and were suppose to get a cot but that never came. It didn't bother us as our kids all sleep together anyways but they took the bed and hubby and I ended up on sofa bed which was NOT comfortable at all. That's too bad. Bathroom was very spacious and had bathrobes which were lovely. We could've used more towels as we had 5 people there. The lunch in the terrace was lovely but service was extremely slow. Our stay included a continental breakfast as well but it was very sparse with not a lot of selection. I would skip it next time and find another place to eat in Old Montreal. Location was beautiful right behind the Basilica and within walking distance to waterfront. Only small annoyance is the valet parking, so if you want to get anything from your car, you need valet to bring it. Overall a very lovely hotel. Not sure I would stay there again because of price but if I found a good rate I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TPHOB
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel choice if you are exploring Montreal. Rooms are exquisite, spacious and well maintained. Ours (suite 410) had a nice balcony over the courtyard, kitchenette, sitting area and a fireplace in the room. Common areas very nice. Free Wi-Fi throughout. Free computer access at the business center in the lobby. Walking distance to most all the sites and restaurants. Front desk helpful and efficienct, went out of their way to make our stay pleasant. Located in Vieux Montreal, and near Vieux Port. Hotel is not perfect. The concierge desk is lacking in both talent and insight. Their courtyard restaurant is beautiful and has unlimited potential, but it is so poorly managed, and is staffed with such unfriendly people that we did not even use it for the free continental breakfasts. We ate at Vieux-Port Steakhouse, Bonaparte Restaurant, Chez Suzette Crepes & Fondues. Would recommend all three. Enjoyed sites and shops along pedestrian walkway of Rue St. Paul. Nice dining, snacks, public entertainment and people watching at the Place Jacques-Cartier. Enjoyed water tour with Le Bateau-Mouche. We were there for Saturday night fireworks.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is a jewel”
Reviews.Author: doofrez
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had 2 stays here over a 2 week period on a trip that began and ended in Montreal. The staff and the location are fantastic. The rooms are beautifully appointed albeit with some questionable furniture pieces. Staying in 2 different rooms gave us a better perspective of things as they have used the same funiture to address different room configurations. We actually had 2 tvs in the second room - #614 which I highly recommend. Facing the inner courtyard is a good idea as it is very quiet in spite of the ambient noise of the air conditioning exhaust. Facing St Paul St can be a very noisy experience. The balconies are small but serviceable. A really nice touch is the L'Ocitanne toiletries that are provided as well as the complementry bottled water that is delivered every evening. The Chateau Frontenac in Quebec was charging $8 for a bottle in the room. Some other reviews have been critical of the continental breakfast but we found it quite good and it is complementry. There is a breakfast menu for those wanting a full breakfast. The concierges were really helpful, courteous and well informed, as were the rest of the front desk staff. The valet staff were also first class and the car came quickly when requested. The bang for the buck in this hotel is outstanding, I have already booked it for a business trip in August.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KMichigan
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here! The decor of the hotel and rooms was very nice/chic. The The room was huge!!! We had a separate bedroom and it had a fireplace and mini kitchen. The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was huge. Everything was very clean. The location couldn't have been better - right there in Old Montreal. The price was also so reasonable for what we got - wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Subpar”
Reviews.Author: lolofosh0sh0
Reviews.Content: I should start off this review noting that my partner and I were traveling with our Golden Retriever Theo. We chose to stay at Le Saint-Supice instead of other hotels after calling the hotel and talking with the receptionist, who was enthusiastic and claimed to be a really dog friendly hotel. We were excited about our booking and had high expectations (we usually choose to stay at the W or Kimpton hotels when we want a dog friendly place but wanted to try this place after reading such great reviews). Upon arriving i was a little turned off by the receptionists lack of life. She was cold and showed no emotion, however, she did tell us we had been upgraded to a suite. We were excited. But upon entering you could tell that we were in the dog section. The room smelled of bleach and cleaning product. Something we NEVER experience at other high end hotels. It really irked me since we do have such a well behaved pup who doesn't bark, chew on things, go indoors plus we are responsible pet owners. Also, isnt that what the pet deposit for? Fast forward to the next day when we leave our hotel around 11 to explore the city. We came back at 3:30 to find an employee and cleaning lady in our room with our pup. No big deal, i guess the cleaning lady was scared of dogs (then why is she working on the pet friendly floor?!) However, i was turned off that the room was not cleaned during the prime rest, get ready before dinner time. My partner and I had to leave the room since our room was just starting to be cleaned. However, before doing so we put something in the safe. I turned around and saw her staring at us punch in our code. It was awkward... i tried to close the door to obstruct but it wasn't happening since two people were there. She was just staring... she didn't even turn around or continue cleaning when we made eye contact. My partner I left and were walking down the street with our pup, when i awkwardly brought it up. He acknowledged it too... so he went back to the hotel and had to ask her to leave the room so he could put a new code into the safe. This is completely unacceptable from a hotel staff. In no way should a guest feel unsafe about leaving possessions in their room. Besides our room should have been cleaned by then and we should not have even had to deal with that awkwardness. Also, the first night we were there we had a turn down service. The second just water left by the door, probably because of our dog Theo. Which again, don't offer a service and then not provide it because of a pet. St. Sulpice could be a nice hotel. It has the bones and location to do so. However, for the price I feel the staff needs to step it up a notch. Doormen and staff should greet you and get to know guests by name. Dog owners should not be treated like second class guests. And would it kill you to smile and be nice?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, friendly and helpful...”
Reviews.Author: timbie
Reviews.Content: We recently traveled to Montreal on vacation with our teenager, and this hotel was recommended to us by friends who had stayed there previously. Although the room with our bed was quite tight, it was great to have a set up where our teenager could have her own space. The location can't be beat, the hotel was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the continental breakfast included was good, although repetitive after 4 days. The croissants were outstanding, and breakfast is served in a nice outside courtyard. The concierge, bartender and desk staff were very helpful with directions and recommendations. When we checked in late at night, the person at the counter had not given us the correct amount of breakfast passes, suggesting that I speak with the manager in the morning. When I went to do so the next morning, the woman there had already been informed and had the breakfast passes ready for us. I didn't even have to go into explaining it. The location is in old Montreal, and the perfect location from which to explore the city. The only time we took our car out was to travel to La Ronde. I was so glad we had chosen to stay there, and have already started recommending it to anyone else traveling with a family to Montreal. We enjoyed staying here better than the Chateau Frontenac in Quebec (we had one room, not a suite there)! I only wish I had remembered to take the book which has all of the hotels in the group they belong to, of which all are suite hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and spacious”
Reviews.Author: OneWayVancouver
Reviews.Content: The St. Sulpice is perfectly located for the tourist wishing to visit Montreal's historic Old City. The hotel is right behind the Notre-Dame Basilica, just around the corner from the main tourist shopping area along Rue St. Paul, and only a few blocks away from many of Montreal's main attractions (Marche Bonsecours, Point a Calliere, Old Montreal docks and riverside park). The old hotel has been completely renovated and updated. Our room was huge â€“ with a big living room separate from the bedroom. Very clean and comfortable. Breakfast buffet was very good with constant attentive service. My wife and I had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a room with a normal (not a Murphy) bed”
Reviews.Author: Coddfish
Reviews.Content: We were allocated a Loft Suite and at first thought the many negative comments on this site about their Murphy beds were over the top as we normally like a firm bed. We are not from North America and had not seen one of these before - they can be folded back up into their frame on the wall to create space. This seemed strange since the suite had loads of space. With a 3 night stay, the bed did seem firm but OK on night 1. Night 2 involved a lot of tossing and turning with the lower sheet not staying in place as it was not big enough to reach under the mattress. Night 3 was the same, also affected by a lot of outside noise until the small hours (a Thursday evening) and I woke up to backache which did not clear throughout the following day. Otherwise, large well equipped room, free wifi and great location. The bed had a decent quilt and pillows, and the bathroom had a separate bathtub and shower. The shower was a bit feeble and (most strangely), the toilet roll was fitted on the wall opposite the toilet and out of reach. Good continental breakfast with juice, meats, various breads and croissants etc, and some delicious pots of panna cotta.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous place to visit”
Reviews.Author: Carolan328
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels, small and large, B&Bâ€™s, and guest houses in every neighbourhood to choose from. I recommend the Sainte Sulpice in Vieux Montreal , close to the Old Port as well as many art galleries and European-style cafes. Opened in 2002, this beautiful hotelâ€™s signature is the very large bedrooms or suites featuring fireplaces, their own separate sitting room and fully equipped kitchenette. Women, be they on business or vacation, will be very happy enjoying the luxurious bathrooms, lush towels and body pampering creams and oils. This very European type hotel also offers a fully equipped Business Centre, Health and Fitness Centre, Concierge and 24 hour room service. The S Le Restaurant specializes in steaks, seafood and delicacies of the region and inside is stylishly elegant, but during the summer months the terrace with wicker chairs, water fountains, flowers and foliage is a most romantic place to lunch or dine for locals and hotel guests alike. Montreal is a city of diversity â€“ be it the multi-national communities, the varied, ethnic cuisines, fascinating neighbourhoods and marvellous mix of people. Everywhere you go the eye alights on interesting architecture (keep a lookout for outdoor spiral staircases along Laval Street), historical buildings, and a myriad of eateries. Of course, shopping the elegant chi-chi boutiques for designer clothes is also an important part of this vibrant city. Bookstores and bars, museums and markets abound whilst the nightlife is comparable to any major European city. Parks abound where you can wander amidst the peace and tranquillity of Mother Nature â€“ Mount Royal Park, the Big Park in the middle of the city, or enjoy outdoor music and dance performances at La Fontaine Park - after all, Montreal is the home of Cirque du Soleil. A well kept secret in Vieux-Montreal are the exquisite gardens of Basilica Notre-Dame and the garden terrace of Le Saint-Sulpice Hotel, its restaurant overlooking the ancient trees of the Sulpician Priestsâ€™ estate next door. The Botanical Gardens are delightful with regional flowers and vegetation, and recommended is the steep but worthwhile climb up Mont-Royal to visit St. Josephâ€™s Oratory â€“ then, during the winter, why not cross-country ski or toboggan down the mountain. Le Saint-Sulpice HÃ´tel www.lesaintsulpice.com 414 Rue Saint-Sulpice

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, will return - hopefully soon”
Reviews.Author: Iluvhhi
Reviews.Content: Superb location, comfortable and spacious rooms with nice amenities. The furnishings may be considered by some to be a bit outdated, but the space, location and staff go a long way to making up for that. Looking forward to our next visit!

Reviews.Title: “This is a very nice hotel in "Vieux MontrÃ©al".”
Reviews.Author: AnikoBudapest
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, the staff is very kind and helpful. The rooms are very comfortable .

Reviews.Title: “Golden Experience”
Reviews.Author: Nizzo_in_RIO
Reviews.Content: I chose the word Golden because for me it means something that last forever or memorable. Sometimes it hard to imagine that you can find in a small hotel the same quality of service that you expect in one big five-star hotel. Le Saint Sulpice is a small place but well located in the beautiful old part of Montreal. At the courtyard I think they have one of the coziest garden that I've seen in the area. Pleasant place to welcome friends or a special person. And regarding the service, what could I say as they have two Clefs d'Or Concierges there just for you! No doubt that those two Golden Keys holders helped me enjoy the most of the city and then leave there with that memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Supremely delightful!”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveler67
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was simply wonderful. I loved the decor of the lobby and the friendly service upon checking in. I arrived around 10:30pm and needed a dining suggestion and the lady at the front desk gave me a nice place to dine about five minutes by foot. This historical section of Montreal is worth the stay. The architecture and history are very interesting. I had a delicious breakfast every morning by room service. Always arrived on time. The room itself is very spacious with a large bathroom and a great view overlooking the main street. My interactions with the staff to be very friendly and ready to help me when I needed it. The Concierge were especially helpful with directions and suggestions for dinner and sightseeing. I highly recommend staying here. Not many hotels in Montreal are as charming as this place.

Reviews.Title: “Apartment hotel”
Reviews.Author: Masca
Reviews.Content: Large attractive rooms with separate bedrooms & kitchenettes. Like staying in an apartment right in Old Montreal. My room had separate tub & large shower. Free wifi. Do not recommend continental breakfast - very small selection of items.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Jack616307
