Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel through TripAdisor reviews, and found it excellent. Away for a long weekend with 2 other couples, we all were upgraded on arrival to Deluxe Suites. Almost all of the staff were friendly & helpful during our stay - front desk, concierge and bell staff were excellent; only a couple of those working at breakfast Sunday morning seemed preoccupied with other things. The cleanliness of the hotel really impressed, especially with bed bug scares these days - the bathroom was spotless. Hotel location is great - walked to everywhere in Old Montreal. Walking distance to downtown, or a short cab ride. Loved the opening windows. All of this, and for a sweet deal of less than $150 per night!

Reviews.Title: “A BIG DISAPPOINTMENT!”
Reviews.Author: Julia1990222
Reviews.Content: I travel across Canada and stay at various boutique hotels across the country. This hotel was the biggest disappointment I have seen in a very long time. At $200.00 night you would expect a top-of-the-line room. Rooms are in desparate need of a facelift and the carpet was disgusting- gum and dark stains. Parking was another $30.00/ night (which was never mentioned upon my booking) and supposedly there was complimentary breakfast (also not communicated). Although I can't comment on breakfast, every thing else was a total disappointment, so I image breakfast wouldn't be much different. I would recommend OPUS over this hotel any day! OPUS is a 10/ 10 and I have stayed before- not in old Montreal. but a hell of alot less expensive with wonderful staff and clean, modern rooms! Julia-

Reviews.Title: “All I imagined Montreal to be!”
Reviews.Author: brookeypoo
Reviews.Content: This is a late, but needed review. I traveled in October to Montreal for a long weekend with my fiance and another couple. I found a great deal on Le Saint-Sulpice, and once we arrived I realized we made a fabulous choice. The location of the hotel is perfect - in old Montreal, and near the water. We walked everywhere during our stay and felt centrally located. The rooms were beautiful - luxuriously decorated. Although some of the furniture was a bit dated, the linens were new and the room felt very clean and well maintained. The suite provided us more than enough room, and even the bathroom was beautiful! The breakfast that was included was very minimal, and we decided to eat elsewhere (our tummies were stretched from so much wonderful food!). One slight annoyance was that we arrived at the hotel two hours before check-in time, and asked if we could access our rooms early. The reception told us they would try to accomodate us. In the meantime we went to lunch, and came back 15 minutes before check in time, but still did not have rooms. We ended up waiting almost 30 minutes after check in time before we could get to our rooms and have a shower, which is a long time after driving from Philadelphia. However, this would not deter me from staying at this hotel. All in all, this hotel impressed me and I loved my stay. I definitely hope to return to Montreal (in a warmer month than October next time) and will consider another stay at Le Saint-Sulpice.

Reviews.Title: “Does not live up to reviews”
Reviews.Author: teenytroot
Reviews.Content: Taking a weekend away to Montreal, we wanted to stay in the old town, and Le Saint Sulpice seemed to be in the perfect location, the reviews on trip advisor sealed the deal - we didn't think we could go wrong. Sadly this was not the case, this hotel did not live up to the reviews, nor the standards expected for this price bracket: 1. The bed in the loft suite is a fold down, and fairly uncomfortable 2. The hypo-allergenic bedding was ancient, without filling in the duvet, nor a duvet cover! 3. The complimentary breakfast was a single glass of orange juice, burnt coffee (also cold) some picked over pastries, cheeses and yogurts - really low standard for a hotel of this 'quality' 4. After two nights none of the toiletries were replenished, so we had to call and ask for more shampoo (not really the norm, again in a quality hotel) 5. Water in room was not replaced All of which would be fine in a room that was $100p/n, but in a high-end boutique hotel in a room costing $200+ per night, it really fails to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Some good, some bad”
Reviews.Author: zacaramarketing
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel very nice. The updates seem to be about done and there was very little sign of renovation during our visit. More importantly, we had no smells to contend with. The location was very convenient and walking everywhere in Old Town was easy. The rooms were great, we got our TripAdvisor upgrade to a well appointed suite with a great bathroom and fireplace. I always find it challenging when very nice old structures effort a contemporary decor but it was pretty well pulled off here. The internet concerns are real. It comes in and out and that is a GIANT PAIN. I also find it strange that a hotel of this caliber does not have a fitness room. The access to one a few blocks away doesn't cut it for me. Also the free breakfast was a very light Continental but better than nothing and really all that is needed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Old Montreal.”
Reviews.Author: travelguy_0923
Reviews.Content: The hotel it's self is in a great location. It's really close to a wonderful little cupcakery just up the street. In all honesty, I would probably stay here again but it wouldn't be my first choice. The room that my partner and I stayed in was a little "worn". The hotel was clean and we had no issues with anything other than it appearing in need of some updates. I just think that it could use a little updating or refreshing. It's not that it was dated it's that it was heavily used type thing, a scratch here and there and the feel that many people had stayed there before you. We were exhausted from exploring Montreal by foot so we primarily only used the room for sleeping. so the hotel had no complaints as far as the bathroom or size of room. The rooms were great size and you're in the heart of Old Montreal. The first weekend of Sept was a great time to visit the city. Lots of festivals and things to do!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Harlequin84
Reviews.Content: From the moment I stepped into the lobby, I knew I had picked the right place for my weekend stay. The staff was warm and friendly, the concierge was incredibly helpful, and within 30 minutes after I'd entered my room, a staff member was already at my door to offer free water and see if everything was okay. The bed was incredibly soft and comfy, and the bathroom had both a shower and large tub, along with ample toilette space in the middle for all of my things. On top of all that, the room itself was gigantic - probably bigger than a studio apartment. The hotel is indeed right in the heart of Old Montreal, literally just behind the Notre Dame Cathedral and only a few blocks from a Metro stop. Extremely convenient, warm, friendly and efficient - would definitely stay over and over again!

Reviews.Title: “Courteous, helpful service”
Reviews.Author: StymieG
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in an excellent location. Rooms on lower floors facing the street are sometimes noisy, but this seemed to die down early. We stayed in a suite, which was very nicely appointed, and very clean. The bathroom was clean and furnished with L'Occitane products. The concierges were all very helpful with dinner recommendations, especially Etienne Bellamare. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great party venue”
Reviews.Author: lelly_9
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were married here last September. The small ceremony was on one of the executive suite balconies overlooking the rooftops of Old Montreal and backed by the Cathedrale Notre-Dame. The living room of the suite was big enough to allow a back up location in case of bad weather. Hotel staff were wonderful every step of the way, facilitating every need (AV equipment, random odds and ends, storing flowers in the wine cellar, accommodating some guests early check-in, manpower moving chairs etc). The wedding packages include cocktail hors d'oeuvres- the quality and range definitely impressed. The quiet central courtyard with landscaping and fountains was a nice place to serve them. The restaurant has private function rooms of differing sizes. I must say that the food for the reception meal was stupendous - best steak I have EVER had :) Their sommelier offered lovely suggestions for accompanying wines. And they had no problem with us setting up our own music to play off their speakers. The hotel itself definitely has an ambiance of class that hits you as soon as you walk in the large, luxurious lobby. Rooms (and bathrooms) are large, noise was not an issue and the Occitaine en Provence toiletries were a great touch. The complementary breakfast is simple and tasty. Reasonably priced for the location (and what a location!) , GREAT upscale reception/event venue, looking for an excuse to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel! Extremely nice staff and amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: clementine78
Reviews.Content: The staff was incredibly nice and helpful, the rooms are HUGE, clean and convenient. we had both a shower and a bath tab, bathrobes, coffee machine in the room, simple but lovely breakfast, and the location is perfect. We randomly picked this hotel while driving by at night, and we couldn't believe our fortune. It was an amazing hotel for a very reasonable price (it was cheaper than far-less-impressive hotels in the area, though it should be noted that we came during the off season so prices were more reasonable). Hugely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Montreal hotel”
Reviews.Author: Empyrerose
Reviews.Content: Great value for a huge room in a perfect location in vieux Montreal. Very happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very fine hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: jsq98
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location on side street neighboring Notre Dame Basilica where you can hear the bell toll. Close to restaurants and just a short walk to the metro. We decided to forego the rental car and instead stayed in lovely Vieux-Montreal and rode the metro to various spots around the city. Hotel exterior is old world, inside more modern. Feels like a small chain hotel, i.e. not overly romantic, but well kept with efficient and kind staff. Our room was starting to show some age in the carpet and sofa, but housekeeping kept the room very clean. Beds not the most comfortable as one was a murphy and the other was a sofa bed. I can sleep on a rock but my husband's back was smokin'. Our room faced the street on an upper floor and you could hear tires on cobblestone and horses clip clopping along. Didn't bother us, but if you are sensitive to noise you may want to request a room not facing the street. Breakfast was a simple and satisfying assortment of toast, croissants, cereal, yogurt, fruit. Very fine hotel in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katherinej77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights over New Year's and had a great experience. It is perfectly located in Vieux Montreal, on the same block as Notre Dame. It is 2 blocks to the Metro and within walking distance to many things. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas with candles and greenery and a cool fake aspen forest out back. Our room was a large suite with bedroom, and a big comfy bed with lots of pillows! There were lots of small details in the room that we loved - first of all it was large and made us feel at home, plus there was a cozy gas fireplace, balcony, large lovely bathroom, two closets in the bedroom, and even a candle for us to light and Nespresso maker for espresso in the morning (with 3 complimentary pods). They also bring bottled water at turn-down service, a nice perk when traveling, and there is a computer in the lobby with complimentary internet access and printing (nice for checking into your flight on the way home). This hotel would be great for longer stays as the rooms are large, and ours had a small kitchen area with a stove-top, dishes, sink and small refrigerator. Overall it is a great value - while it isn't cheap, these perks add up and make you feel like you've gotten a great experience for the cost. Our only complaints were fairly minor -- the room wasn't ready at check-in, but we only waited about 30 minutes. There were a few maintenance/cleanliness issues -- the latch on one of the closets in the bedroom was loose and fell off while we were there, and there were some shards of broken glass on the bathroom floor when we checked in. Unless those issues become worse over time, we would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Huge suite in ideal location at low price”
Reviews.Author: GourmetChaplain
Reviews.Content: We booked directly with the hotel and got the best rate: $136 per night (plus taxes and parking) between Christmas and New Year's Eve for a basic suite. We were upgraded upon check-in to a deluxe suite, which means huge living room with sleek kitchenette (hidden microwave and fridge, mini-stove, sink, and Nespresso capsule coffee maker!), separate bedroom with normal bed (basic suites have murphy beds, though both types have the same mattresses) with ample closet space, huge bathroom with soaker tub, separate shower and two sinks, and front entryway and hallway for additional storage space. There were two flat TVs, free wireless, a pullout sofa, desk and chair, armchairs, Globe and Mail daily paper delivery, and free (included in our rate) continental breakfast in the downstairs restaurant until 10 am (they let me do takeout one morning to bring food and coffee back to my suite). The croissants and pain au chocolat were delicious! (breakfast also included cheeses, yogurt, toast, cereal, OJ, muffins, etc.) Parking cost $25 plus tax (higher for huge SUVs) for valet and local outdoor public lots were similarly priced. There was a computer in the lobby free for use if you don't have a laptop. No pool. Only two problems happened: one day, no maid service appeared and I had to phone to request it upon our return to our room after 3:30 pm. On our last morning, no Globe+Mail was delivered and upon requesting it, they said they would send one up, but then another staff phoned back to say there were none available (it is included in the rate; upon check-in, you can waive the paper and get a small refund of 75 cents per day). However, there were usually other papers available free by the elevator in the lobby, such as the NY Times. We ate dinner around the corner at Garde-Manger and down the street at Le Club Chasse et Peche, both of which were excellent. Good coffee was harder to find nearby, though we loved the quality and taste of the in-room espresso capsules. This is a 4 star hotel that gets it right, and is great value for the money we paid; though, I understand during high season and F1 race it can be over $500 a night for the basic suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a few minor issues”
Reviews.Author: Mark97
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Saint Sulpice. My wife and I stayed there fore a couple of nights in the summer and were very happy with our stay. We returned for 2 more nights over new years. The location of the hotel is perfect - right n the heart of Old Montreal. The building is a perfect mix of old, elegant charm with modern renovations and amenities. Our room was a 1 bedroom suite. When we arrived, we noticed that the carpeting was lifting up from the floor in a number of spots. Not a huge issue, but not what you would expect in a hotel like this. The room was otherwise clean and well appointed. The pillows, however, were hard and not very comfortable. Also, we had to leave the window open in the evening to keep the room from getting too hot. Despite setting the temperature for 19 degrees, it would not drop below 21. One final minor issue - the shower took a couple of minutes to get hot each morning. None of these were major issues, but they add up. The room came with a continental breakfast in the restaurant. Basic fare, but tasty and the service was very good. We did not eat dinner in the restaurant. The morning of our second day, when we called the valet for our car, we were told it would take up to 15 minutes. After waiting for about 30 minutes my wife mentioned something to the front desk staff, and they immediately waived the parking charge for that day. Otherwise, we had no issues with the valet parking. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would likely return, however I hope that these minor issues do not continue to increase in number or severity.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; don't pick a room facing the street!”
Reviews.Author: outofottawa
Reviews.Content: We just enjoyed an overnight at the Saint Sulpice. Lovely hotel with one unfortunate problem, the street noise. We arrived and were greeted by a valet who promptly whisked our car away. Check in was fast and courteous. We went up to our room and were impressed by its size and furnishings. It had as its primary sleeping unit, a Murphy bed which was quite comfortable though small for two people. It was definitely smaller than our Queen at home. Sheets and pillows were of superior quality. Additionally, there was a couch that unfolded, if required, into a bed. The room was equipped with a Tassimo type espresso machine with three complimentary pods. Very nice. There were also a small cooktop, microwave and plates etc. if you wish to make something though we did not. The bathroom has a radiant heat type floor which was a nice treat on a cold Canadian winter morning. The shower pressure was a little weak but not overly so. For a bathroom of this quality, a rain type shower would have been more appropriate in my opinion. There was a nice work area and easily accessible free Wifi. My only major concern is the unfortunate noise level from the street. Even when people were conversing at normal volumes outside e.g. doorman giving directions to a cab, we would easily hear it in our room. This was not a problem as this type of occurrence happened during day or evening hours. However, it was much worse when late night revelers were walking past our hotel on their way home. I was woken up at least 6 times during the night, with each passing group and I am a very sound sleeper. I would stay in this hotel again but ONLY in a room that did not front the street. I think the hotel would be best served by investing in some sound proof windows as if I were offered my room again, I would have to decline.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tishphotog
Reviews.Content: Beautiful architecture and decor, helpful front desk and bellmen, nice room, great location in old town, good value. Only down side: when room was cleaned, robes were left on floor in a pile!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but scrutinize the cleaniliness of the room before accepting it.”
Reviews.Author: SilverLake2TheWorld
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 11/23, late in the day (for me) and tired. First room they had us checked into had red carpet stains. Second room they put us in was on ground floor right next to outside terrace. Murphy bed was lowered by staff so didn't notice the dried orange fluid (orange juice/vomit?) on the frame of the murphy bed until the next morning. Yuck! Place is nice but not spectacular, for the amt of $, if you can get another hotel w/a WARM breakfast take it. Their breakfast is a choice of 3 cereals, 3 types of cold pastries, dried fruit and yogurt). The concierges: Maxim, Etienne and Alan were very informative. Housekeeper Guadalupe was very sweet. Overall nice stay, but not something to rage about. Next time, I'll try a different place. Definitely recommend you check out the room, even under the sheets, before accepting it. Also, on the Friday nite that we were there the downstairs bar hosted a very loud party which went on until the wee morning hours. I was awoken at 4 am by people smoking and laughing loudly in the outside terrace. If business travel is what you are after, you may want to opt for a quieter place. Although the staff were very apologetic to the hotel guests the next morning, that wasn't going to replace the sleep everyone had lost the nite before. It should be noted that the entire hotel only has ONE pc for internet access and it's in the lobby next to the valet, no privacy and sometimes you have to queue up to use it. Last note: The murphy bed is located next to the kitchenette. I am a light sleeper and was awoken on the 2nd nite by a dripping noise that resembled Chinese torture. I turned on the fan to muffle the sound and woke up with a sore throat the next day. I couldn't locate the origin of the drops, but definitely don't stay in room #120 if you're a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a weekend in Downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: deltakilo34
Reviews.Content: This place is very nice. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Location is minutes away from the downtown right in the heart of old Montreal. Next time I come to Montreal I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Beauty in Heart Of Old Quarter”
Reviews.Author: M_Stewart68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Saint Sulpice in early October. The hotel has a perfect location right in the heart of the Old Quarter. Lots of restaurants and attractions in the surrounding area. The hotel staff is excellent, the rooms are beautiful with great bathrooms. Restaurant us good quality and group members enjoyed meals there. Concierge and front desk staff was warm and helpful. The doorman are always there to help and offer a smile. Stop reading these reviews and book it! There is nothing not to like with the Saint Sulpice. We travel and book hotels all over the world, this one is a keeper!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not super fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: WineCheeseChocolate
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed after reading the tripadvisor reviews because I was expecting something out of this world. This is a nice high end hotel. Things were clean, things looked pretty, and things were safe. It was nice. It wasnt cozy or unique or romantic. The bathroom had a walk in shower and a tub which we liked. The bedroom was set apart from the living room which would be nice for parents so they could close the doors while the kids sleep in the living room I suppose. There was a mini kitchen area where we made breakfast. The concierge downstairs helped us decide where to go to dinner and made reservations. All in all, it was a nice high end hotel. It was quite large so it did not feel initimate but it was nice. The location is nice as it is right around the corner from Notre Dame and across the street from a cupcake shop and a tea shop. There were a few restaurants walking distance. Would work well for business travel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great on almost all accounts and highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelTarzana
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite which was beautiful, roomy, comfortable and full of lovely amenities. The lobby is classy and beautiful. The staff worked hard to please, day and night. The location is superb. The breakfast buffet could use a bit of improvement, but offered variety and decent quality. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and lovely suite - however, many hidden charges”
Reviews.Author: MalcolmSteve
Reviews.Content: My husband, our dog and I stayed here for a long weekend and mostly found the experience very pleasing. We had a nice suite that was very spacious and comfortable with a nice view. The location is perfect for sightseeing in Old Montreal and very near to good restaurants, galleries, etc. They were also very welcoming of our dog. One thing that was dissappointing were the hidden charges that were not at all explained up front. I immediately had a hold put on my credit card without any explanation beforehand. I also was unaware until checkout that I was being charged for internet use. I was offered and given the Wi-Fi information without mention of cost and therefore used the internet more than I would have had I known I was being charged. I also had to pay $1.00 for each local call I made. Again, had I known this was the case I would have used my cell phone which would have had a cheaper rate even with it being an international call. I was also informed prior to my stay by Hotels.com that the parking rates were $15.00 per day, only to find out it was actually $25.00 per day. Another disappointment was the "continental breakfast" I ordered through room service. The description made it sound plentiful and worth the $16 charge. However, it was one plate with a few pieces of overly ripe melon, a miniature muffin, two miniature croissants and a small dannon yogurt. It definitely makes more sense to go around the corner to the quaint little cafe that will charge you half that price for a full breakfast. (Also, just a tip, don't; even ask for the mini bar key - go to a convenience store and pick up all the drinks and snacks your heart desires as even a can of coca cola costs $3.50) Again, the staff were very polite, especially the maintenance staff and door men. And the space was comfortable, attractive and convenient. It's just unfortunate that the hotel is not forthcoming about many of it's charges which makes them seem unprofessional.

Reviews.Title: “A suite surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Hoofmark
Reviews.Content: Our suite was very large with an seperate bedroom. The location was excellent for all that we wanted to do in Montreal. The Concierge Mr. Ethier was exceptional and made everything work for us from getting lost luggage through customs to recommending great out of the way places to eat. The hotel was a great surprise and I would highly recommend it, that is except for its continental breakfast which has horrid including moldy fruit and nice but confused wait staff. Eating their regular breakfast was fine but the wait staff was no less confused. Hopefully they have fixed the breakfast continental breakfast, how does one mess that up so badly?

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SebagoGal
Reviews.Content: As we were checking into the hotel - the front desk clerk told us "You booked on Expedia, those rooms aren't ready" After hearing this I was thinking they're going to put us in a broom closet in the basement. That couldn't have been further from the truth. After having lunch we came back and were shown to our room on the 4th floor. The room was so much larger than your average hotel room. The sitting area had a working fireplace and a view of a pretty little park that the brides walk to after getting married at Notre Dame. The little kitchenette was perfect right down the "real" cream for my coffee not powder. The bathroom was roomy with both a huge soaking tub and a walk in shower that showed your silloette in the bedroom. My only complaint would be the bed - Queen size with very comfortable bedding but it was a Murphy bed that had some kind of velcro all around the frame - so everytime you got out of the bed it scratched your legs- even pulled my nyons. Other than that minor annoyance, I would absolutely recommend the St. Sulpice to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful hotel; excellent location in Vieux Montreal; and very attentitive staff.”
Reviews.Author: TinaHoy
Reviews.Content: Beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of the old town, perfect location for Rue St Paul which is the main drag. Hotel spotlessly clean, and our suite was very well equipped with a little kitchenette, and a fantastic bathroom (with L'occataine toiletries-my favourite!!). The hotel staff were extemely pleasant and helpful and made us feel really welcome. The hotel also has a fantastic aroma throughout. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated for the price despite nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: MTHSydney
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights here as was attending a 3 day conference and wanted to see Montreal also. Chose it based on the location in old Montreal & it had kithchenette as. The location is perfect, you actually feel like you are in Europe and downtown is only a 15 minute walk away. The rooms are spacious, well equipped and a little dated but who cares! The main let down was the service and the noise. My first night was a Saturday and the live music in the restaurant over the road combined with late night revellers meant that I was bothered till about 3am, fortunately Sunday night was quiet but the weekday nights there were noisy as well, garbage trucks at 5.30am and roadworks commencing at 7.30am each day. The service was also a bit disappointing as couple of days after arriving I checked my credit card statement on line and discovered I was charged $310 by the hotel, even though I had prepaid my accommodation. I asked the desk about this and they said it was standard procedure and it would be reversed when I check out, which is fine but I should have been advised this was the case at check in and was not. Then I asked the concierge about day trips to Quebec city and was advised the tour operator only does 2 trips a week at this time of year and the dates did not suit me due to the conference but he gave me the tourist brochure anyway. When I read it later the brochure clearly stated daily tours till end of October, I checked on-line and yes this was the case so approached a different concierge the following day who fed me the 2 trips a week response. I had to show him the brochure and explain that I had checked on line before he called the tour operator and I was booked in on the day I wanted. i got the same sense of indifference from the restaurant staff the 1 night I ate there as I wasnt prepared to go back. This is a lovely place, in a great location and the suites are well equipped, but if you are a light sleeper you must request a courtyard facing room, and the staff could be a bit more friendly and that would make the whole experience much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: KIR215
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Saint Sulpice recently for a wknd visit. Wonderful hotel with well appointed suites; plenty of room to spread out. Loved the opening French windows in our room. The hotel staff were superb; always friendly, courteous & wonderfully helpful. Had a problem with a window one night at 11:00pm & hotel staff were there in 5 minutes to correct the problem. If you're looking for a special hotel in old town Montreal give the St Sulpice a try. I think you'll be very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cindy_Matteo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, classy and centrally located. Couple blocks from view port and one block from the Notredame cathedral. Subway is down the street for furher destinations, everything else is in walking distance. Staff is very helpfull. Rooms are great. We had a huge suite with living room, bedroom and big bathroom with occitane amenities. Breakfast was included in the rate and was really good, continental had lost of fresh berries, cereal, croissants, orange juicy and good service. Served in courtyard, even on rainy and cold days it is heated and dry. Would definitely go back even if a little expensive. Cindy & Matteo (Florence Italy)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but some problems”
Reviews.Author: gc914
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of the good reviews, suite rooms and the great location. The location cannot be beat in old Montreal. The hotel was pretty and the rooms were large. The bed was marginally comfortable. This is an important consideration for me. Unfortunately during our stay the weather was unusually hot. 93. The hotel air conditioning could not keep the room less that 80 which made for some very uncomfortable nights. Add to that the leather furniture on sticky bodies. Since Montreal usually does not have that weather, it should not be a problem but for us it had to lead to a lower rating for the hotel. It had me wishing we had even stayed in a chain for the air conditioning. Otherwise, the hotel was very nice and the staff was very accomadating

Reviews.Title: “All in all a great choice for Vieux Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: cadby
Reviews.Content: We just finished a four night stay at Le Saint Sulpice and were very satisfied. If you are looking for a property in the Old Town, this location is ideal. Very close to all the Old town attractions, yet minutes from downtown, the plateau, all of Montreal's appeal. We reserved a superior suite with a separate bedroom and living area. It was very spacious, clean and very fairly priced. The kitchenette, while small was just fine for our needs. The room overlooked the garden, which could be noisy but in spite of that was very nice. The staff and service was attentive enough and responsive. The rooms and common areas were always clean and well kept. We didn't eat at the hotel except for the continental breakfast which was serviceable. We really enjoyed this hotel and would recommend it to any one looking for a luxury hotel in Old Town Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “NOT dog friendly”
Reviews.Author: canadianexpats469
Reviews.Content: To start off, I'll say that we frequently travel with our small dog. We purposefully seek out dog friendly hotels so as not to annoy other patrons. Our dog has travelled with us extensively and this is the first time we've had a problem. When making our reservation, I explicitly let the hotel know that we would have him with us. Unbeknownst to us, they have a "dog" floor (the 1st). Well, we were placed on the 3rd floor and it was a disaster from the get go. As soon as leaving for dinner at 9pm the first night, we were called because the dog was barking. We immediately returned home to calm him (first night and all...). This pattern repeated itself throughout the weekend (2pm in the afternoon, noon, 3pm). Now each subsequent time we returned the dog was NOT barking. We waited outside the room for 20 mins each time...no barking. The geriatric American couple next door apparently had decided to spend the entirety of their vacation holed up in the bland corporate hotel rooms the Saint-Sulpice offers, and they had ZERO tolerance for even 10 mins of barking (when the maid would walk in,etc). We offered to change rooms, but the hotel could not accommodate. The frequent calls from the hotel and their demands for us to return were ruining our vacation. We went to the front desk to try to sort something out, and the concierge proceeded to tell us that we would have to either SIT in the room at all hours with the dog OR take him with us everywhere. Only after prodding did he finally admit that the 1st floor was the dog floor and that they had failed to place us in such a room (incidentally, we walked the first floor...FULL of barking dogs). The concierge was rude, condescending, and dismissive. I explained to him that if the hotel had told us that they were dog friendly if and only if 1) the dog NEVER barked and 2) if he did, the couple would be expected to stay in the room with the dog the ENTIRE time, that we never would've reserved a room here. The situation was incredibly frustrating because the hotel blamed us for their mistake. Each time we returned, the dog was NOT barking. Each time they called, we rushed home. Had they simply had us on the 1st floor, with the rest of dog rooms, all of this could've been avoided. Instead, they were utterly inflexible. The only service staff member of any merit was Matthew---the late night concierge. Overall, old Montreal is full of gluttonous American tourists. It's more akin to Epcot Europe than anything resembling an authentic "old world" experience. The Le Saint Sulpice has a crowd that's decidedly senior citizen, with a noise threshold that would satisfy the most stringent of rest homes. Do yourself a favor and stay somewhere else.....

Reviews.Title: “Oh my God it was wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Canadoc
Reviews.Content: I went on business so I didn't chose it. I would stay there again in a heartbeat. It oozes charm, but in a good way. One stairwell has some of the old wall exposed so you can see how it must have looked hundreds of years ago. The wall even smelled old! But the rest was too notch modern. Just staying there was a thrill and experience. Outside my room horses trotted by and stopped to pick up visitors for a tour. The staff were second to none. They printed my boarding pass for my flight home and made my stay very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience met expectations - and web pictures!”
Reviews.Author: kjsec
Reviews.Content: It is rare that a hotel looks as good in person as it does on the web, but this was an exception - it looked just as good if not better. The lobby area was warm & welcoming, the staff was friendly & helpful, and the outdoor patio is an oasis. Breakfast was served outside - lovely and adequate buffet included in our room rate, charming & entertaining staff member who makes fresh fruit smoothies & offers everyone shots of it to sample. Lovely space, very tranquil, great for any meal or just a cup of tea with a book in the late afternoon. Our room was a one bedroom with queen bed, plus a living room with Murphy bed at one end for our teenager, plus a kitchenette. Juliette balcony overlooked the patio area with view of the grassy lawn behind the hotel. Quiet, lovely, well-appointed, clean, ample soft towels. One small item was repaired within hours of reporting it. Location is ideal for exploring the old port area of the city with its great architecture, shops, galleries and restaurants, and wasn't too far to walk up to St. Catherine Street and that area. We parked around the corner on St. Francois-Xavier for about $15/day. Great stay, and would return.

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary!”
Reviews.Author: bazarov
Reviews.Content: Montreal is one of my favorite cities and Le Saint-Sulpice is easily my favorite hotel in the city (and one of my favorites period). Excellent location and beautiful rooms - I've never slept better! This hotels gets my highest recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest room(s) ever!”
Reviews.Author: weekendwanderer09
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first night of our honeymoon recently and what an incredible start to our trip! We were actually on a stop-over in Montreal so were just looking for somewhere clean and comfortable to stay before our connecting flight but were absolutely blown away by the hotel when we arrived. We think the hotel must have upgraded us as the room was just unbelievable for the price we paid. We had an enormous roof terrace with views over old Montreal, log burning fire, whirlpool bath, enormous and extremely comfortable bed, we were so sad that we were only staying for one night. The room was not the most up-to-date, but so comfortable and enormous, it really didn't matter.

Reviews.Title: “Large modern new rooms for business traveller of small family”
Reviews.Author: Whendrik
Reviews.Content: Excellent service with a real smile, at the desk, for breakfast and at the door. In the heart of old town Montreal, next to the Cathedral close to most restaurants. The rooms have a large bed and a good quality pullout for a family. The lofty shape is trendy, allows for light to enter the room, but does not have some level of privacy for a family. A kitchenette may be handy for some, but could have done without.

Reviews.Title: “Three stays and will return again”
Reviews.Author: lookhereMissouri
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Perfect location to explore old town. Wouldn't even consider any other hotel in town. Our third visit and certainly will return again. The comp. breakfasts alone would bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Professional and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Fevil
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on the final leg of a NYC to Montreal road trip and there was no better place to round off the holiday. Friendly staff, a very knowledgeable concierge, well equipped, spacious rooms and a lovely elegant feel throughout. If you're considering booking a stay here, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: welochicago
Reviews.Content: Picked the hotel after finding a good on line deal and reading strong reviews from other travelers. I didnt see any issues with carpeting or age of the rooms as others had noted. I think we got a recently renovated room. Room was great, concierge (Ettien?) was excellent he reall understood what we were looking for in restaurants and shopping, and the location cant be beat. My only issue would be that we were on the first floor facing the street so our room was a bit noisy and we couldnt not open our curtains. Otherwise great boutique hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, They Way a Hotel Stay Should Be”
Reviews.Author: pjalmtlansing
Reviews.Content: Everything we needed was there, every question we had was professionally addressed. Great location, we walked everywhere. Healthy breakfast choices. Complimentary internet. Clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “More than a boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_lp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love boutique hotels and by far, the Saint Sulpice is our favorite getaway. It's located in old Montreal by the Cathedral and surrounded by great shops and by loads of entertainment. The food and staff are always spectacular, and the location is superb. I understand that there are options to purchase a suite. It is well worth it since there are many festivals that occur in Montreal such as film festivals, and the famous jazz festival. During the Christmas Holidays, they do a superb job of decorating as well. Overall, it is an ezqusite boutique hotel and charming in every way!

Reviews.Title: “brief but comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: highway61nola
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 15 yo dau. spent two nights here last week after getting a summer special rate. We were upgraded to a suite that appeared to have been recently renovated. King bed was great. Not so much the couch and Murphy bed. Roomy enough for our purposes. Several lighting fixtures didn't work - would have been a nuisance if I were a business traveler. Location is great, central. Front of house staff was great - helpful, pleasant and cheerful. Wife had problem with noise emanating from the courtyard and/or street at late hours - she's a very light sleeper but if you are as well, you may wish to ask about noise issues for your specific room. Only real beef I had was really slow service for the breakfast buffet, having to get up to get ourselves, coffee, coffee cups, cutlery, condiments. You would think that staff seeing your predicament would come to rescue, but they appeared clueless (and quite young and not well-trained). Rule #1 is get the coffee out hot and quick ands then keep checking back regularly. The staff needs extra training and a senior food 'n bev person on-site to get this operation in gear. And maybe an extra set of hands at peak service times. At the prices being charged there is really no excuse for this level of service. None. I couldn't get the wi-fi to work either. On the plus side, my wife asked for a room fan the second night to drown out the outside noise and staff gladly obliged. The second day we had breakfast off-site, which was a much more enjoyable option.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect spot to hold a summer wedding!”
Reviews.Author: ErikAlison
Reviews.Content: We recently hosted our daughter's wedding in the garden at the Saint-Sulpice. The staff was extremely efficient as we planned this out of town event: the event coordinator was especially enthusiastic and detailed. We were not disappointed: the rooms are spacious and comfortable and have great provisions for a family: we especially liked the espresso machine on our bar. Continental buffet breakfast is included in the cost of the room: fresh fruit and excellent croissant. The dining room was ours for the event, and the meal was of the highest calibre. the location is smack in the middle of Old Montreal - take advantage of the valet parking. Our entire party had only positive things to say about this location.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Goodbloke1
Reviews.Content: I spent just two nights here on a road trip which started in New York. Large room and living area, very clean, well laid out, comfy bed, good location, friendly staff. Whatever the wifi problem was that other reviewers mentioned, the hotel have come good on resolving as it worked fine from everywhere anywhere near the hotel. Overall I was really happy with my choice of hotel in Montreal. Nothing not to like here.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: bigrick0068
Reviews.Content: We were two adults and one 13 year old and we all thought the room was one of the best hotels we had EVER stayed at. we were there on a thursday so our rate was also excellent. Right in the heart of old Montreal, two blocks from Science center. Thanks St-sulpice!

Reviews.Title: “quite pleased”
Reviews.Author: namrof
Reviews.Content: Deluxe Suite 5 nights vacation for family of four w/ young kids. Excellent value and perfect for our specific needs. Central Old Mont. location. Quiet, roomy suite. Small hotel. Marriott quality but with much more character and better service. Excellent concierge. Avoid buffet breakfast. If no need for suite, would go elsewhere more upscale.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Passenger_Side
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Le Saint-Sulpice for a long weekend. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would stay again...although we probably would try a different hotel the 2nd time around. Pluses: - Location: it is near many sites in Old Montreal and two blocks from Metro station. - The staff was awesome, especially the concierge. - Plenty of room in the suite Minuses: - Poor room design. The living area and bathroom were excessively large and the bedroom was too small. - wi-fi completely unusable in the room. - Room service did not promptly collect dirty dishes in hallway - The bed quality does not live up to room price. The king bed wasn't horrible but it was not good either. After reading reviews prior to our trip I learned that this 4 star hotel actually uses Murphy beds in some rooms. I called the hotel and requested normal bed, which they agreed to assign. The good news was that the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The bad news was the non-Murphy bed wasn't that great either. - They over-do the air freshener in the rooms (perhaps because they allow pets?). Bottom line - this is a fine hotel and most of the negatives were not all that bad. We got a pretty good price on the room (under $200/night) so I could overlook some of the issues. I would have been disappointed if I had paid in the $250+ range. Based on recent management comments, it appears they are working towards addressing the two biggest problems, the beds and the wi-fi. Other thoughts: - We found the best restaurants to be in the Plateau area while the ones in Old Montreal were generally overpriced and very average quality. While the metro is only 2-3 blocks away from Le Saint-Sulpice, the blocks seem long in 90 degree heat (probably longer in freezing weather). If you don't want to spend $ on cabs throughout your stay you may want to consider locations that have easy access to the Plateau area. - We picked up a 3 day museum and metro pass at the tourist information center for $50/each....a great value and we didn't have to worry about paying fares and admission everywhere we went.

Reviews.Title: “good but not great”
Reviews.Author: educationtogo
Reviews.Content: Like many of the other reviewers of this hotel, I appreciated the location, the courtyard restaurant, the valet parking and the staff, especially the concierge. Our suite was larger than I expected and the bathroom fixtures were very modern and luxurious. However, the living area of the suite was a bit worn and dated. The bedroom was quite small relative to the rest of the suite. My only genuine annoyance on our 4 day stay was when our neighbours had ordered room service for either breakfast or lunch and the dirty dishes remained in the hallway for most of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMAustin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 4 nites here and both agree that this is a well situated (virtually in the heart of old Montreal right next to the Notre Dame) and very good value hotel. Since the rooms are suites you have more than ample room, a small refrigerator and even a stove. My only complaints are that the room was a little on the shabby side (The carpeting showed signs of wear, as well as the furnishings), the wifi did not work, and the Murphey beds are uncomfortable. Other than that, the hotel's public spaces are well appointed, and there is a nice patio bar and a restaurant. Can't address the quality of the restaurant as it was a bit too pricey (breakfast buffet $45). During our stay, the wifi was for the most part unusable. However, ask at the front desk and they will provide an ethernet cable. What they don't tell you is that on the last day you will get a bill for the cable ($10) which will be reimbursed if you return it. Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with a unique...”
Reviews.Author: XwonderlandX
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel with a unique decorating style located in old Montreal. Great staff( French speaking, or the ones I saw) and clean, gorgeous rooms. I stayed with two children and it seems fine, though it's not a "family hotel" I think. Great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: BenBombo
Reviews.Content: The good: -- The hotel is clean and modern. -- The staff is reasonably efficient. -- The bathrooms are large The bad: -- The promised wi-fi did not work in the room. Very frustrating. -- There are no night stands or reading lights next to the bed. -- The neighborhood is very touristy. Low-class t-shirt shops, tacky restaurants and dubious art galleries are the only nearby businesses. The ugly: -- Most of the rooms have queen-sized Murphy beds. Impractical and uncomfortable. Why they installed these ridiculous contraptions is baffling. -- You can't watch television from the bed. The tv is bolted to the desk on the other side of the room, facing a sofa. The lesson: Don't get your expectations up too high after reading TripAdvisr reports.

Reviews.Title: “Dog-friendly; great location; clean modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: MARworld
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous about this hotel because the reviews were mixed. People complained about worn out carpets, rude staff, and uncomfortable beds. We have been treated extremely well by 99 percent of the staff here (with one minor exception, a front desk person who was just stressed out). The room is gorgeous (a deluxe suite), with a nice carpet, well-maintained furniture, and two flat screen TVs. The balcony overlooks a quiet garden. The location is perfect (in my favorite part of Montreal). The bed is a queen bed, and I'm used to a king; but aside from that, it's comfortable. Nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Le St. Suplice”
Reviews.Author: honeymoontobali
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Le. St. Suplice in Montreal for Memorial Day weekend. We were very impressed with this boutique hotel! The room/suite was very clean and quiet. The concierges were excellent. Etienne was especially great in helping us recommend some excellent local restaurants. We recieved an upgrade and the room/suite was larger than our apt in NYC! (The bathroom was definately larger than in our apt!) Overall, the hotel was very roomy,very clean and it is in a very location in Old Montreal. We will certainly be back for another stay at Le. St. Suplice!

Reviews.Title: “Truly wonderful experience, I want to go back!”
Reviews.Author: LydiafromGreensboro
Reviews.Content: We drove in after long day of traveling mishaps including many airport delays. My husband and 7 year old were tired and starving. What a treat to walk in the doors to a delightfully scented lobby and very accommodating staff. Luckily the restaurant was open late and they gladly served us one of the best meals we had while in town. The room was a large suite with a Murphy bed (the coolest sleep ever for a little boy!) The bed was very comfortable with perfect feather pillows. Our room was directly above the restaurant and I was concerned about noise but it was not a problem as it was not open too late and they covered the patio in the am. The location is unbeatable, close to great restaurants, shopping, museums. The only problem was we were never able to access the wireless, signal too weak, otherwise We LOVED this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kctoler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Montreal in late April because he was attending a conference which was located at Saint-Sulpice Hotel. We decided to add a few extra days to explore Montreal since we had never been there before and spent six nights at Saint-Sulpice. We found that the hotel was in the perfect location in Old Montreal, literally around the corner from Notre-Dame Basilica, about two blocks from a Metro station, and just off Rue Saint-Paul, which is the oldest and most charming street in Old Montreal. There were so many sights, shops, galleries and restaurants within easy walking distance. We were very pleased with this hotel. Our room was spacious with a kitchenette, living room, desk with wireless Internet, and a large bathroom with a shower and soaking tub. We also had a small balcony that overlooked a courtyard. Our bedroom was a separate, small room and I was surprised how quiet it was---we slept well. We were also at the end of the hallway, so we did not have many shared walls. The decor was more contemporary than traditional. My only complaint is that the carpet was a little bit worn and puckered in our room, but otherwise we were very pleased. A continental breakfast was included in our room. It was fine but nothing special, as continental breakfasts usually are. We did not eat any other meals at the hotel, although they have a nice courtyard cafe that would be enjoyable in warmer weather. We found the staff to be friendly and polite. Overall, I would recommend this hotel, particularly if your budget is less of a concern.

Reviews.Title: “the most beautiful weekend...”
Reviews.Author: stoney36
Reviews.Content: just returned from a fabulous weekend in montreal with my hubby...the hotel was superb...the lotus flower fragrance upon entering the lobby was incredible...the location perfect...the linens sublime...the sound of the church bells from our open courtyard window heavenly...i want to go back!!! we'd stay here again that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Swede40
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Montreal for two nights with our young children. We reserved a suite which was perfect because it was rather large and very clean. The location was fantastic in Old Montreal with plenty of restaurants in walking distance. I did not give the hotel 5 stars because of two reasons: First of all, I agree with the person who reviewed the hotel before me about the concierge. We had two very hungry young kids and we wanted a convenient French restaurant in the neighborhood. The concierge circled a place on the map which was illegible and finally when we found the place (after 20 minutes of walking around), the restaurant told us that we could not come in with small children because it is a bar/club. So we ended up finding our own place. Nevertheless, we didn't ask the concierge for further advice. Secondly, parking is ridiculously expensive. It cost us $32 a night to park our minivan. We found out at the end of our stay that the garage down the street charges $15 a night. Too bad, we didn't know about that earlier. Aside from the above issues, we had a great stay. The breakfast is very cozy and the hotel atmosphere is perfect for Montreal. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel okay; good location”
Reviews.Author: Traveler_from_CT_USA
Reviews.Content: Pro: We enjoyed being in the heart of Old Montreal and loved the hotel's lobby and our room's little balcony. Housekeeping and the doormen were helpful and cheerful. Con: While the towels were a bit frayed and a blanket very torn, it didn't bother me as much as the disinterest of the concierge. We spent a good half hour walking our hungry teens up and down a street our first night in town, trying to find a French-Canadian restaurant that the concierge identified with a circle on our map. When we double-checked the information with him the next day, he went online and gave us the address. That night we found it -- it was an unmarked restaurant in a barely marked hotel (looked like a commercial building.) Families who stay here would do better just to walk any of the nearby streets and check out the menus themselves. Perhaps this concierge is most helpful when your requests are more extraordinary. We still recommend Montreal though, it's really a unique gem of a city. Everyone we met was friendly â€“ from the service people to fellow bike riders and museum visitors.

Reviews.Title: “the best on every level..service, value and location”
Reviews.Author: drcho2112
Reviews.Content: This is a very late review and is coming on the heels of some terrible service at another hotel. This bad experience had me thinking "jeez, these guys need to learn a little customer service from..... and Woila...Le Saint Sulpice popped in my mind. I was traveling on business for what turned out to be a difficult customer install which left me stressed out at the end of every day. So it was great to come back to a very welcoming staff and clean elegant room everyday. With a great neighborhood full of shops, restaurants , and art galleries I never had to venture far if I didn't want to. Then there is the beautiful church right on the corner along with the charming narrow cobblestone streets which made you really feel like you were in "Old World" Montreal. On top of the great ambience, the service I received was the best. I had arrived during hockey playoffs and was intent on watching my favorite team being a die hard team. Cruising the channels I couldn't find it and was scrambling to figure out what station it might be on. Not knowing the stations in Canada, I called down to the front desk. The desk immediately sent some one up( someone into sports) and they went through all the channels with me and when we couldn't find it, he then used the internet to verify what station it should've been on(which it wasn;t) after apologizing for something that was beyond his control, I thanked him and proceeded to stew about not being able to watch. Ten minutes later, he comes back up and had found a canadian site streaming the game online. I promptly found the site and ended up happily watching the game. While this may seem trivial, to me it was going the extra mile as he saw how p***** off I was. They were also great with tips on restaurants, directions etc. I gladly recommend this place and look forward to bringing the wife back for a romantic trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mahjarunner
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough great things about this hotel. I went to Montreal with my 9 year-old son and mother in September 2009. We booked this hotel through Expedia.com and got a suite on the top floor for $210 per night, including taxes. The suite was huge and beautiful. The bathroom had a huge oval tub and Gilchrist and Soames toiletries. Seriously, the bathroom was the size of 2-3 normal bathrooms. There was a separated bedroom with a queen size bed, vanity area, and bathrobes. The bedroom had french doors to the living room which had a fireplace, tv, sleeper sofa, and a few chairs, plus a writing desk. Off to one side was a kitchenette that had a microwave, fridge and all the stuff you need to cook. One of the things I really loved though was a huge wall of windows that you could open and walk out onto a tiny balcony. We ate out on the patio one night and you could see the river. I liked the location a lot because its 2 blocks to everything, but you somehow feel this part of the Old Town is just a little quieter. This hotel is literally right next to Notre Dame Cathedral, which I didn't realize until we got there. If you are in Montreal on a weekend, some of the hotels can be really noisy due to the bars below and open windows, so I liked that it wasn't so noisy. The hotel came with a free breakfast, which was a nice little buffet with pastries, fruit, yogurt, and some meats, plus the waiter gave you juice, coffee, and water. Only 2 persons were covered, so we had to pay extra for my son, which wasn't a problem. The property itself is a boutique type hotel with a small rear garden (I think the restaurant may serve lunch there?), a wine cellar/breakfast area, and there was also a free business center. Or business closet (literally it was a tiny room), but whatever -- there was a computer I could use for free to print out my boarding passes. I brought my laptop with me, so I also had free wi-fi in my room. I wasn't that thrilled with the connection speed though, so I didn't use my laptop very much. The only downside to this place is there is no pool or exercise facility, and they don't give you passes to go elsewhere like many hotels in this price range. The service was quite nice - on my last day we had to get a cab at 6am and they were all cheerful (we, of course, were not) in helping us get everything ready and loaded. We had a great time in Montreal, which is a great city, and I'm sure a big part of it was how much we liked our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angten
Reviews.Content: Our son and daughter-in-law arranged a 50th wedding anniversary celebration at the hotel. The staff was uniformly helpful and gracious. There were 18 of us (including children) and when we checked in the concierge welcomed us personally and wished us happy anniversary. We were extraordinarily fortunate and the weather was warm and sunny the whole weekend. We were able to have our before dinner drinks and canapes on the terrace. The celebration dinner at the hotel was excellent. Each evening bottled water was placed next to the beds - something one never gets even at the most upscale hotels in Europe. I have a theory that there is a correlation between the quality of hotels and towels: the towels were wonderful. The continental breakfast was fine although it would have been nice to have had rolls as a choice. Some of our party ordered cooked breakfasts which looked quite nice. One afternoon some of us had lunch on the terrace. Although service was slow, the food was good. Our one caveat: there is deferred maintenance and the carpets in the room should be replaced as should some of the couches, especially in our daughter's room. Our room, though, was perfect as we had been upgraded. The location in the heart of Old Montreal, near restaurants and the waterfront, was superb. If we ever returned to Montreal there is no question we would stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Montreal”
Reviews.Author: knitaholicGTA
Reviews.Content: I took my husband for a weekend away to celebrate his 40th birthday and I wanted to make it a special weekend for him. The hotel was the perfect beginning to a wonderful weekend. Right from the front door we were greeted by smiling faces and helpful employees who made every effort to meet our needs. The staff were always very prompt with any requests (such as running right up to deliver an internet cable for our laptop when we had difficulty with the wireless connection) to calling for taxis for us when needed. The room was beautiful and even had a wood burning fireplace (we did not make use of this, but it was a really nice touch). The location of the hotel was ideal for exploring the old section of Montreal. We had dinner in the restaurant Le S on Friday night. The food was incredible!! Service from Simon was impecable and there was even a lovely jazz trio to entertain us. Overall we loved our stay at Le Saint Sulpice and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: NovaScotiaJess
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights and loved our room! The hotel was sophisticated, and luxurious. My partner and I are a younger couple and we were treated with the highest level of respect. The front desk staff recommended a wonderful restaurant within walking distance, and were helpful in answering all of our questions. We would definitelyu stay here again. The close location to subway services made moving around the city in the nasty cold Quebec winter tolerable! Next time we will visit in the summer so we can enjoy more of this beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location in old Montreal and great staff!”
Reviews.Author: dramktg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel New Year's Eve to join the celebrations in old Montreal and have brunch with family members New Year's day in their restaurant called the S (Saint-Sulpice right?). We were given an upgrade without even asking and it was uphill from there. The decor makes up part of a hotel's features and this one does quite well that way but, the what stands out in our minds is the staff. From the valet parking attendant to the restaurant's waiting staff, we were looked after with professionalism and a positive, happy attitude which is somewhat lacking these days. All in all we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Virtual_Ted
Reviews.Content: I love montreal, this hotel was available at a good value and came highly recommended. Very pleased with the location and hotel in general although slightly disappointed with saunda and fitness centre. I think there are better values out there...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place: Hardly Great”
Reviews.Author: manoverboard
Reviews.Content: The St. Sulpice is a very nice hotel that proudly displays all it's awards from Trip Advisor on their check in desk. That was the first time I had seen that. Wow! Then, as we tried to request a king size bed for our two children (6'4" and 6'2") we were politely, if it can be polite, by Simon that we had not paid enough through Sky Auction to have a room with a king sized bed. O.K., so now within the first five minutes I've been told I'm a cheap guy, which I am. Still, I don't like to be told that. The first room we were shown had a stained and ripped carpet, so I guess they mistook my children for those dogs they are supposed to allow. Perhaps, I had not paid enough. Careful of those doggy rooms as they told me they are not a restricted set of rooms in the hotel. So if your room looks it, it probably had Rover as a guest for a recent night's stay. We later got two rooms that were more than adequate and bordered on 'luxo, but without premium TV channels I wondered how luxo it really was. The internet connection did not work well on wireless in my room and they desk clerk quickly came up with ethernet cables (no deposit - thank you) so that we were up and connected in no time. I found the amenities to be quite nice and only noticed one major design flaw. There was a frosted glass window between the bathroom and the sleeping area. So when this old guy got up to use the loo in the middle of the night he risked waking up his partner as she wash suddenly awash in the warm glow of the bathroom lighting. She didn't wake, but a light sleeper might have done so. The next morning we found our favorite newspaper (not a local one) outside our room. That continued until the weekend when it abrupt;y stopped. The front desk reported the had not gotten delivery. I found the staff to be most helpful and friendly, Prior reviews have commented on this in a negative way but I found nothing to criticize. They even gave me some secret hints as to where to park my car on the street for free in this otherwise cramped and expensive parking area of town. The valet parking seemed o.k but was not in my budget. We did not eat at the restaurant although we walked through it several times as a shortcut to get out of the hotel onto the next street. The breakfast buffet looked tired and unappealing to me. In the evening, the restaurant was fairly empty and a very tired trio played exceptionally tired music with a consistently tiresome beat. Even if the food were great (and I have no idea) , the music would have driven me away. I had the sense this restaurant could be a great place with a little work. I heartily recommend the St. Sulpice with the above caveats. Do try to get it at a substantial discount to the rack rates. The discounts are out there and that's what the place is worth, not the heavy prices they advertise. And don't worry if the desk clerk knows you are budget minded. They won't treat you any differently than those who pay twice as much as you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful space and great location”
Reviews.Author: southernbychoice37
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Montreal and we chose Le Saint Sulpice based on the glowing tripadvisor reviews. We were not disappointed! Our room was actually a small apartment--separate bedroom, living room w/electric fireplace, kitchenette, balcony overlooking the outdoor dining area and gardens and a large, extremely well appointed bath. Grohe fixtures, a beautiful molded glass vanity, large tub and an enormous shower. There was plenty of closet and drawer space, the furnishings were very nice and the queen bed was comfortable with high quality linens. As a coffee addict, I especially appreciated a large, 12 cup coffee maker supplied with a more than acceptable blend--no tiny pot dribbling out foul brown water like most hotels. The location of the hotel is superb--right next to Notre Dame, an easy walk to the Metro and in the heart of Old Montreal. My only quibbles: some of the walls were scarred in places and in need of repair and paint and the carpet was stained and frayed in spots. As a previous reviewer noted, pets are allowed in some of the rooms and I suspect the carpet issues can be attributed to that. All in all--a very pleasant experience in a wonderfully unique city.

Reviews.Title: “We had excellent service, concierge help and a wonderful suite.”
Reviews.Author: bellringergirl
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Saint Sulpice. The hotel is located in Old Montreal so we could walk everywhere. We had a three room suite (BR, LR/Kitchenette and Bath) that was like having our own apartment. There is a real neighborhood feel to the area and we were right around the corner from the Notre Dame Basilica. There are many restaurants in the area, plus we found a grocery store and a pharmacy within a 10 minute walk of the hotel. The staff was courteous and helpful and the service excellent. We plan to return to Montreal and will stay in the Saint-Sulpice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant yet comfortable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: DBAToronto
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed for four nights in a one-bedroom suite at the HÃ´tel St-Sulpice while I was attending a conference at the Palais des CongrÃ¨s. We were very pleased with the hotel. The front staff were exceptionally friendly and efficient. The lobby had a European charm, and the our room was very comfortable and modern-looking. (Although it was quite cozy for us, with a rambunctious toddler and a baby.) The hotel was very quiet, which was appreciated! The complimentary Internet service and nightly bottled water service were nice touches. The included continental breakfast was also good. The restaurant had excellent food at dinner, including a children's menu, although the service was average. The location can't be beat â€” adjacent to Notre Dame Basilica and very close to lots of lovely restaurants throughout Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel with excellent staff in charming historic area”
Reviews.Author: Neodesha
Reviews.Content: The suite was hugh, bathroom upscale, resturant and garden lovely. Although we had read mixed review on the breakfast--we enjoyed it and had good service both days. The front desk was really helpful and pleasant. The location is in the charming historic district-- within walking distance of excellent resturants, waterfront, and a block from the Notre- Dame Basilica (we toured it during the day and were glad we went back for the light show that night before we went out to dinner.) Not inexpensive but excellent value. We were there for a couple of days before leaving on a cruise and found it a wonderful place to start our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: oldchina
Reviews.Content: Vacation with 3 sisters and Mom for Mother's Day. The only place I could find where the suite could accomodate 4 of us nicely. Clean, bright, and comfortable plus and it is right in the Old City (which was good for my mother). There outdoor dining area was great for lunch! Good staff, too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bunkhedena
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights over Columbus Day at this hotel. It was excellent. The location can't be beat--the hotel is right next to Notre-Dame Basilica. We had a suite with a private bedroom and a living room. The room was well decorated and the hotel was well maintained. We were very happy about Le Saint-Sulpice. Montreal is well worth visiting. The drive from the New York City metropolitan area took about 5 1/2 hours. The leaves were changing as we drove through the Adirondacks. It is easy and safe to walk in Montreal, and we had no problems driving and parking. The restaurants are excellent. We took the official tour of Vieux Montreal, visited Pointe-Ã -CalliÃ¨re (the Museum of Archeology), Jardins Botanique and Mont Royal Park. In sum, Saint-Sulpice is an excellent hotel in an excellent city.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon hotel”
Reviews.Author: jgmd19
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Le Saint-Sulpice for the first half of our honeymoon. The value was incredible! The room was huge and the location can't be beat. We were able to walk almost everywhere we wanted to go. I've read others complaints about the complicated breakfast process but my husband and I never had any issues. We thought it was perfectly fine, especially considering the room rate. We had a wonderful dinner at S. The thing that stood out most about the hotel was the service--it was impeccable! The concierge was very attentive and friendly. For example, when our luggage was left behind by our airline and we weren't likely to get it delivered to the hotel until 2:00 in the morning, the concierge offered to bring us complimentary toiletries and carefully checked our preferences for contacting us when it arrived. I was exhausted by that time and so greatful for their help.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary get away...”
Reviews.Author: QI_GM
Reviews.Content: Being a hotelier myself, I was impressed with the hotel and it's staff. Very nice room with great views. Staff was friendly and very helpful. A beautiful hotel in old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to be”
Reviews.Author: PatC3
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at Le Saint-Sulpice in Old Montreal and were thrilled with our visit. The location is fantastic, right in the middle of everything in Old Montreal; right behind Notre Dame and a short stroll to many restaurants and the park along the waterfront. Only two blocks to the metro, which can take you just about anywhere in the City. We were upgraded to a suite, which was bright, clean, comfortable and roomy with a sofa, easy chair, desk. There is a kitchenette area with stove, microwave, refrig and stocked with dishes, pans and glassware. The view out the windows (which can be opened - a plus) looks like my memory of France, with cobblestone streets and old buildings. The staff is professional, friendly and efficient. I would return in a heartbeat and am recommending this to you. It made our trip to Montreal so much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for Vieux Fort”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoAlli
Reviews.Content: I stayed here two nights with eight other friends in honor of a friend's bachelorette "weekend". We were in three rooms which comfortably slept three people per suite with everyone having their own bed. Turn down service was excellent in converting the murphy beds and pull out couches into sleep ready beds each night. The location is perfect for sites in the old town, although construction in the area meant traffic could be a real pain. The front desk was quite helpful with directions and suggestions for food and drink. The compimentary breakfast was good, but I'll admit I've had better. It mostly concentrated on continental selections although hot food was available. I have already recommended this hotel to other friends visiting Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alisonb98
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and stored our luggage with the desk clerk. When we returned later that afternoon the room was not ready so they upgraded us to a suite at no extra charge. The room was large, clean and quiet. The staff was extremely friendly and professional. The evening turndown service provided the next day's weather report along with some complimentary bottled water for the hot days ahead. The only weird thing was the overwhelming smell of stale perfume in the lobby. It was very distracting. aside from that, I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The quality and personal touches make it worth while”
Reviews.Author: DiboTraveller
Reviews.Content: The Saint Sulpice Hotel was an excellent choice for us in Montreal. We stayed for a week with a 6 year old child. The location was excellent, right in the old town and close to the Congress Centre and Metro station. The lobby was sophisticated and pleasant. The staff were friendly and helpful. The breakfast was fresh and tasty and the waiting staff very obliging and friendly. Our daughter was made welcome. We found the suite comfortable and bright. The beds were excellent in terms of support, pillows and linen with plenty of storage space and cooking facilities. The hotel delivers those personal touches and little details that take it beyond the usual slick sophisticated but ultimately a bit bland international chains.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to St. Sulpice hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: IMissLibby
Reviews.Content: My husband and daughter (age 14) spent two nights at the Hotel St. Sulpice in Montreal. The hotel is located in Old Montreal and very close to the Cathedral. We chose the hotel because it offered a suite with an enclosed bedroom so we could have privacy. We were delighted with the tastefully decorated room, comfortable bed & comfortable enough pullout sofa; with the quaint balcony, and extremely professional service at the front desk. We also received free breakfast for 2 each morning and that was delicious too. I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Another plus, the hotel lobby had a subtle but nice fragrance - verbena, I think. Really nice. This hotel would be equally good for business travelers, families with older children and friends on a weekend shopping/cultural trip. You can walk to the shops and restaurants of Old Montreal.
